diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Serum sickness–like reaction due to amoxicillin
doctor_hist:
When did the symptoms start relative to starting the antibiotic, and what antibiotic was it?

The symptoms started about two days ago, after I began taking amoxicillin for my sinus infection.

Have you noticed any facial swelling, hives, or trouble breathing?

No, I haven't had any facial swelling or trouble breathing. But my skin is really itchy and I have a rash.

Can you describe the rash (spots vs. hives), and where on the body did it start and spread?

The rash looks like red spots, and it started in the crease of my elbows and knees. It spread to my trunk and arms, and now it's on my legs too.

Are your joints swollen or painful to move, and do you have any swelling of the lips or eyelids?

My joints are painful to move, and they feel a bit sore, but I don't have any swelling in my lips or eyelids. 

Do you have any swelling of your hands or feet, or a purple bruise-like rash?

I don't have any swelling in my hands or feet, and there's no bruise-like rash. Just the itchy red spots and the joint pain.

Any fever pattern or temperature readings?

I’ve been having a low-grade fever, and it’s been around 99 to 100 degrees Fahrenheit. It comes and goes, but it’s been there for the last two days.

Have you noticed dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or tummy pain?

No, I haven't noticed any dark urine or yellowing of my eyes or skin, and my tummy doesn't hurt at all.

Have you had any recent sore throat, cold symptoms, or new medications/vaccines besides amoxicillin?

I haven’t had any sore throat or cold symptoms recently, and I haven't received any new medications or vaccines besides the amoxicillin.

Have you noticed swollen or tender lymph nodes, especially in the neck or behind the ears?

No, I haven’t noticed any swollen or tender lymph nodes in my neck or behind my ears.

Any mouth sores, eye redness, or peeling of fingers/toes?

No, I haven’t had any mouth sores or eye redness, and my fingers and toes aren’t peeling either.

Any new or worsening breathing, wheeze, or chest tightness since the rash started?

No, I haven't had any breathing issues, wheezing, or chest tightness at all since the rash started.

Do your joints look visibly swollen or just painful without swelling?

My joints are just painful; they don't look visibly swollen. They feel achy when I move them, but I can't see any swelling.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Sinding-Larsen–Johansson disease (juvenile traction apophysitis of the inferior pole of the patella)
doctor_hist:
Hi, I’m Dr. Agent—where exactly is the pain located (hip, knee, ankle, or foot)?

It's mostly in my left knee, and it hurts when I walk or run.

How old are you, and did the pain start suddenly after an injury?

I'm seven years old, and no, it didn't start after an injury. It just started hurting one day while I was playing.

Any swelling, redness, or warmth over the knee?

No, there's no swelling, redness, or warmth. It just hurts when I move it.

Any pain in the hip or groin, or does the knee pain worsen at night?

No pain in my hip or groin, and the knee pain doesn't really get worse at night. It just hurts when I’m active.

Does it hurt when you press on the front of the knee, especially just below the kneecap (tibial tubercle)?

It hurts a little when I press on the front of the knee, right below the kneecap. But it's not super painful.

Any recent growth spurt or increase in running/jumping activities?

I haven't been running or jumping more than usual. I think I've been playing the same amount as I always do.

Any morning stiffness, limping more after rest, or pain in other joints?

No morning stiffness, and I don't limp more after resting. My other joints feel fine; it's just my left knee that hurts.

Any tenderness at the very top of the shin (tibial tubercle) when you jump or kneel?

It hurts a little when I jump or kneel, especially at the top of my shin. I try to avoid those kinds of movements.

Any trouble fully bending or straightening the knee, or is range of motion normal?

I can bend and straighten my knee normally; it just hurts a bit when I do certain movements.

Any limping or change in gait when walking or running?

Yes, I’ve been limping a bit and favoring my left leg when I walk or run. It feels a bit wobbly sometimes.

Have you noticed a tender bump at the top of your shin just below the kneecap?

No, I haven't noticed a tender bump there. It just hurts when I move or press on it.

Have you recently been ill or had a sore throat, rash, or fever?

I haven't been sick or had a sore throat, rash, or fever. I'm feeling fine otherwise.

Any locking, catching, or the knee giving way during activity?

No, it doesn't lock or catch, and my knee hasn't given way when I'm playing. It mostly just hurts when I move it.

Any pain or tenderness at the bottom of the kneecap (patellar tendon) or pain with resisted knee extension?

It hurts a little at the bottom of the kneecap when I press there. I can feel some pain when I try to kick my leg out or extend it too hard.

Does the pain improve with rest and worsen during running, jumping, or climbing stairs?

Yes, it gets better when I rest, but it really hurts when I run, jump, or climb stairs.

REQUEST TEST: Knee_X-Ray_Left (AP_Lateral)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Any sports that involve frequent jumping or kicking (e.g., soccer, basketball)?

I play soccer sometimes, but I don't do a lot of jumping or kicking. I mostly just run around.

Any tenderness at the lower pole of the kneecap itself when I press there?

It hurts a little when you press on the lower pole of the kneecap, but it's not really bad. I can still walk, just a bit limp.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Sinding-Larsen–Johansson disease (juvenile traction apophysitis of the inferior pole of the patella)

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Chronic bronchitis (non-smoker) with chronic productive cough, likely nonasthmatic eosinophilic bronchitis or chronic neutrophilic bronchitis contributing; HRCT negative for bronchiectasis and spirometry showing restrictive pattern with normal FEV1/FVC.
doctor_hist:
Can you tell me how long the cough has been going on and if it’s mostly dry or produces phlegm?

I've been coughing aggressively for about 11 years, and it produces a lot of thick, foamy, yellow-green sputum.

Do you smoke or have a history of smoking, and if so, how much and for how long?

I am a non-smoker and have never smoked in my life.

Have you ever been diagnosed with asthma, COPD, or had frequent lung infections in childhood?

No, I’ve never been diagnosed with asthma or COPD, and I didn’t have frequent lung infections in childhood. However, I've had multiple bouts of bronchitis over the years.

Have you noticed shortness of breath, wheezing, or chest tightness with exertion or at night?

No, I haven't noticed any shortness of breath, wheezing, or chest tightness at all. My symptoms are mostly just the cough and the sputum.

Have you had fevers, night sweats, weight loss, or coughing up blood?

No, I haven't had any fevers, night sweats, or weight loss, and I've never coughed up blood. My symptoms remain focused on the cough and the sputum.

Have you had any sinus issues, nasal congestion, post-nasal drip, or acid reflux/heartburn symptoms?

I haven't had any significant sinus issues or nasal congestion, but I do sometimes notice a bit of post-nasal drip. I've never had heartburn or acid reflux symptoms.

Have you ever had a chest CT scan or sputum cultures done to look for chronic infection or bronchiectasis?

I haven't had a chest CT scan, but I have had sputum cultures done in the past. They haven’t revealed any chronic infections.

REQUEST TEST: High-Resolution_Chest_CT_SCAN

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Have you had pulmonary function tests (spirometry), and if so, what were the results?

I haven't had pulmonary function tests done yet. I’m not sure what the results would show.

REQUEST TEST: Spirometry_with_bronchodilator

RESULTS: FVC: Reduced, FEV1: Reduced, FEV1/FVC Ratio: Normal

Do you have a chronic wet cough most mornings for at least 3 months in 2 consecutive years?

Yes, I do have a chronic wet cough most mornings, and it's been ongoing for more than 3 months over the years, especially during exacerbations.

Have you had any occupational or environmental exposures (dusts, fumes, biomass smoke, mold)?

I haven't had any significant occupational exposures, but I do live in an area with high humidity and some mold issues in my home.

Have you ever been evaluated for cystic fibrosis or primary ciliary dyskinesia in adulthood?

No, I haven't been evaluated for cystic fibrosis or primary ciliary dyskinesia as an adult. My previous evaluations focused mostly on bronchitis.

Have you noticed greasy, foul-smelling stools, chronic diarrhea, or fertility issues?

I haven't noticed any greasy or foul-smelling stools, nor do I have chronic diarrhea or fertility issues. My symptoms really focus on the cough and sputum.

Any history of childhood ear infections, chronic sinusitis, or recurrent pneumonias in family members?

I don't have any history of childhood ear infections, but my family has had some instances of chronic sinusitis and recurrent pneumonias, particularly in my siblings.

Have you ever had testing for immunodeficiencies (quantitative immunoglobulins) or frequent unusual infections?

I haven't had any testing for immunodeficiencies, and I haven't experienced frequent or unusual infections either. My main concern has always been the persistent cough and sputum production.

Have you noticed that your cough and sputum are consistently worse in the mornings and improve during the day?

Yes, my cough is definitely worse in the mornings, and I notice that it tends to improve as the day goes on.

Do you frequently hear crackles or rhonchi when you breathe, or has anyone mentioned those on exam?

I haven’t had anyone mention crackles or rhonchi during exams, and I don’t notice them myself when I breathe. My main focus is really just on the persistent cough and the sputum.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Erythema toxicum neonatorum
doctor_hist:
When did the rash first appear—at birth or after coming home?

The rash first appeared yesterday, about three days after birth.

Are the bumps small pustules on a red base that seem to spare the palms and soles?

Yes, the bumps are small pustules on a red base, and they do spare the palms and soles.

Are the pustules transient, appearing and disappearing within hours, and is the infant otherwise well?

Yes, the pustules seem to appear and disappear within hours, and I don't have any other issues.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Generalized myasthenia gravis
doctor_hist:
Can you describe how long the weakness and fatigue have been going on?

I've been feeling this way for about a few weeks now, but it seems to get worse by the end of the day. It's really hard to keep up with my daily activities.

Do you have any other symptoms like shortness of breath, chest pain, dizziness, fever, weight loss, or changes in sleep?

I haven't experienced shortness of breath, chest pain, or dizziness. I also haven't had any fever or weight loss, but I do feel more tired than usual, especially at night.

Have you noticed muscle weakness affecting specific areas (like hips, shoulders, eyelids), or any trouble chewing, swallowing, or speaking by day’s end?

I've noticed some weakness in my eyelids, which makes it feel a bit harder to keep my eyes open. I haven't had trouble chewing, swallowing, or speaking, though.

Have you noticed double vision that worsens as the day goes on?

Yes, I've experienced mild double vision, and it seems to get a bit worse as the day progresses. It's really unsettling, especially when I'm tired.

Have you noticed that rest improves the eyelid droop or double vision, and do symptoms worsen after prolonged activity?

Rest does seem to help a bit with the eyelid droop and double vision. After I’ve been active for a while, the symptoms definitely get worse. It feels like they just drain my energy even more.

That pattern suggests neuromuscular junction fatigue. Any difficulty holding up your head, climbing stairs, or brushing hair by day’s end?

I've definitely noticed it feels harder to hold my head up towards the end of the day. Climbing stairs and even brushing my hair can be quite taxing, and I feel much weaker doing those activities later on.

REQUEST TEST: Ice_Pack_Test_for_Ptosis

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Acetylcholine_Receptor_Antibodies (binding, blocking, modulating)

RESULTS: Positive (Indicates the presence of autoantibodies to acetylcholine receptors, which is associated with myasthenia gravis.)

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Seborrheic keratosis
doctor_hist:
Hello, what does the rash look like (color, bumps vs. blisters, scaly or smooth)?

They're brown and greasy-looking but mostly flat. They have a somewhat smooth texture and aren't painful or itchy at all.

Do they appear “stuck-on” and waxy, with well-defined borders?

Yes, they do appear stuck-on with well-defined borders. They have that waxy quality that makes them look almost like they're part of my skin.

Great, where on your body are they located, and roughly how many are there?

They're located primarily on my forehead, and I would say there are about six or seven of them. They seem to be increasing slowly over the past few months.

Any personal or family history of skin cancer, and have any lesions changed rapidly, bled, or looked different from the others?

I don't have any personal or family history of skin cancer. None of the lesions have changed rapidly or bled; they all look quite similar to each other.

Any itching, irritation with friction, or cosmetic concern you’d like treated?

I don't have any itching or irritation, but they are a bit bothersome cosmetically since they change my appearance. I'd like to find a way to address them if possible.

Understood—any new or single lesion that looks different from the rest?

No, all the lesions look quite similar to each other. There haven't been any new or single lesions that stand out or look different.

REQUEST TEST: Dermoscopy_of_lesions

RESULTS: - Vital Signs: - Temperature: 36.8°C (98.2°F) - Blood Pressure: 135/85 mmHg - Heart Rate: 72 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 14 breaths/min - Skin Examination: - Inspection: Multiple well-defined, brown, greasy plaques of varying sizes on the forehead. No erythema or edema around the lesions. - Palpation: Lesions are slightly raised with a rough texture. No tenderness on palpation. - Dermatoscopy: A network of cerebriform patterns without evidence of melanocytic activity. - Biopsy Report: - Histopathology: Hyperkeratosis with horn cysts, consistent with seborrheic keratosis.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Seborrheic keratosis

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Silicosis with associated pulmonary fibrosis (occupational pneumoconiosis)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe how long the shortness of breath has been worsening and if it’s sudden or gradual?

It's been getting worse over the past year, gradually. I notice it a lot more when I'm active or doing any kind of physical work.

Do you have chest pain, wheezing, cough (with or without sputum), or swelling in your legs?

I haven't had any chest pain, wheezing, or cough recently, and there's no swelling in my legs. Just the shortness of breath, mainly during activities.

Do you have a history of smoking, lung disease, heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, or anemia?

I don't have any significant past medical history, and I've never smoked. No history of lung disease, heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, or anemia either.

Have you noticed any unintentional weight loss, night sweats, fever, or fatigue?

I haven't noticed any unintentional weight loss, night sweats, or fever. I do feel a bit more fatigued than usual, especially after doing physical activities.

Have you noticed swelling in your abdomen, bluish lips, or waking at night short of breath?

I haven't noticed any swelling in my abdomen or bluish lips. I also don’t wake up at night feeling short of breath.

Have you ever had fainting, palpitations, or reduced exercise tolerance compared to a year ago?

I haven't experienced fainting or palpitations. My exercise tolerance has definitely decreased compared to a year ago; I find it harder to keep up with activities that used to be easy for me.

Have you ever been exposed to dust, chemicals, mold, or pets at home/work?

I worked in the glass manufacturing industry for 20 years, so I've been around dust and various chemicals. I don’t have pets at home, though.

REQUEST TEST: Pulmonary_Function_Tests (spirometry with bronchodilator, lung volumes, DLCO)

RESULTS: - Vital Signs: Heart Rate: 72/min, Respiratory Rate: 30/min, Blood Pressure: 130/80 mm Hg - Respiratory Examination: No visible cyanosis or use of accessory muscles for breathing. Symmetrical chest expansion. Resonant note on both sides. Diminished respiratory sounds bilaterally. - Chest Radiograph Findings: Interstitial fibrosis with reticulonodular infiltrate on both sides, eggshell calcification of multiple adenopathies. - Pulmonary Function Tests Findings: Reduced FEV1/FVC ratio with reduced diffusing capacity for carbon monoxide. - Occupational History: Long-term exposure to silica dust.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Silicosis with associated pulmonary fibrosis (occupational pneumoconiosis)

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Exertional dyspnea likely due to early/emphysematous COPD with preserved spirometry (early smoking-related small airways disease)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe your shortness of breath—does it occur at rest, with exertion, or when lying flat?

It only happens with exertion, not at rest. I can walk a short distance, but I start to feel very winded. I haven’t noticed any issues when lying flat.

Do you have chest pain, palpitations, leg swelling, cough, wheezing, or unintentional weight loss?

I occasionally have a dry cough, but no chest pain, palpitations, or leg swelling. I haven’t noticed any unintentional weight loss either.

Have you ever smoked or been exposed to occupational dusts/chemicals?

Yes, I’ve smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years. I haven't been exposed to any significant occupational dusts or chemicals.

How old are you, and do you have any history of asthma or COPD?

I’m 60 years old, and I don’t have a history of asthma or COPD. I've been mostly healthy up until now.

Have you noticed sputum production, fevers, night sweats, or recent respiratory infections?

No, I haven’t noticed any sputum production, fevers, or night sweats. I also haven't had any recent respiratory infections.

REQUEST TEST: Spirometry_with_bronchodilator_response

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do you have any chest tightness or wheezing during exertion?

I haven't felt any chest tightness or wheezing during exertion. It's just the shortness of breath that worries me.

REQUEST TEST: Chest_X-Ray

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Exercise_Stress_Test_with_Oxygen_Saturation_and_ECG

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Have you noticed muscle weakness, especially in your thighs or difficulty climbing stairs?

I haven't noticed any muscle weakness or difficulty climbing stairs. I can manage those activities, but I still feel very short of breath when I exert myself.

Have you experienced anxiety, panic, or significant stress that coincides with your shortness of breath?

I haven't experienced anxiety or panic related to my shortness of breath. It's just been a gradual increase in the breathlessness itself. No significant stress has triggered it either.

Have you had any acid reflux, frequent heartburn, or chronic throat clearing?

I haven’t had any acid reflux or frequent heartburn, and I don’t really clear my throat often either. It’s mostly just the shortness of breath and the occasional dry cough.

Have you noticed any change in exercise tolerance over days vs. consistently the same each time?

I've noticed that my exercise tolerance has been gradually getting worse over the past couple of months. I can't manage my usual activities without feeling increasingly winded.

Have you had any recent travel, prolonged immobilization, or calf pain suggestive of blood clots?

I haven’t traveled recently, and I don’t have any calf pain or swelling. I’ve mostly been at home and active with my usual routine.

Have you noticed hoarseness, throat tightness, or difficulty getting air in during exertion?

I haven't noticed any hoarseness or throat tightness, and I can get air in, but it feels more laborious during exertion. It's mostly just that overwhelming breathlessness.

Do you have any sleep issues like loud snoring, witnessed apneas, or daytime sleepiness?

I haven't had any sleep issues like loud snoring or daytime sleepiness. I sleep relatively well at night and don’t think I've experienced any apneas.

Have you had any exposures to birds, mold, hot tubs, or new home/renovations?

I haven't had any exposures to birds, mold, or hot tubs. My home environment hasn't changed much either; no recent renovations.

Do you have gradual ankle swelling by day or need to stop to catch your breath more on inclines/stairs than flat ground?

I don’t have any ankle swelling, but I do notice that I need to stop to catch my breath more on inclines or stairs compared to flat ground. It’s definitely more pronounced when I exert myself.This is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Central retinal artery occlusion (right eye)
doctor_hist:
When did the vision loss start, and did it happen suddenly or gradually?

It started about 30 minutes ago, and it was sudden. I was just watching TV when it happened.

Do you have any eye pain, headache, or pain with eye movement?

No, I don’t have any eye pain, headaches, or pain with eye movement. It just feels like I can’t see out of my right eye.

Do you see anything at all (light/shadows) in the right eye, and is the left eye normal?

I don't see anything at all in my right eye, and my left eye feels normal. I can see clearly out of it.

Do you have any vascular risk factors (high blood pressure, diabetes, high cholesterol, smoking, atrial fibrillation, recent neck trauma)?

Yes, I have a history of high blood pressure, diabetes, and I smoke about 10 cigarettes a day. I also have coronary artery disease.

Any flashes, floaters, a curtain over vision, or recent jaw pain/scalp tenderness?

No, I haven't had any flashes, floaters, or any sensation like a curtain over my vision. I also haven’t experienced any jaw pain or scalp tenderness recently.

REQUEST TEST: Visual_Acuity_and_Pupillary_Exam_including_RAPD_and_Fundoscopic_Exam

RESULTS: - **Blood Pressure:** 160/85 mmHg - **Heart Rate:** 88 bpm - **Respiratory Rate:** 14 breaths/min - **Temperature:** 36.8°C (98.2°F) **Ophthalmic Examination:** - **Visual Acuity:** - Right Eye: No perception of light - Left Eye: 20/50 vision - **Pupillary Light Reflex:** - Right Eye: Absent - Left Eye: Present - **Intraocular Pressure:** - Right Eye: 18 mmHg - Left Eye: 16 mmHg - **Fundoscopy:** - Right Eye: Pale, white retina with a bright red area within the macula. Normal optic disc. - Left Eye: Normal examination findings - **Accommodation:** Intact bilaterally

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Vasovagal syncope with brief convulsive syncope
doctor_hist:
Can you describe what happened right before and during the loss of consciousness, including any warning symptoms?

I started feeling really sweaty and pale while sitting and getting my tattoo. Then everything went black, and I remember feeling a bit shaky before I passed out. I think I might have moved a bit before I came to.

Did you quickly regain consciousness without confusion, and were there no tongue bites, incontinence, or significant injuries?

Yes, I regained consciousness quickly and felt alert and fully oriented right after. I don’t remember biting my tongue or anything like that, and I didn't have any injuries from the fall.

Any history of similar fainting episodes, triggers (needles, pain), heart disease, or family sudden death?

No, I haven't had any similar fainting episodes before. I don't have a history of heart disease, and there's no known family history of sudden death.

Did anyone notice pallor and sweating, and how long were you out?

My boyfriend noticed that I looked really pale and sweaty just before I fainted. I was out for about 30 seconds.

Any chest pain, palpitations, or shortness of breath before or after the episode?

No, I didn't experience any chest pain, palpitations, or shortness of breath before or after the episode. I felt fine once I regained consciousness.

Did you feel nauseated or have blurred vision, ringing in ears, or tunnel vision before fainting?

No, I didn't feel nauseated, and I didn't have any blurred vision, ringing in my ears, or tunnel vision before I fainted. I just felt really sweaty and pale.

Did you have any jerking of limbs or stiffening, or was it more of a brief slump?

Yes, there were some jerky movements of my arms and legs for a few seconds while I was out. It felt like my body was shaking involuntarily.

Were the jerks brief (under 15 seconds) and did you recover immediately without confusion?

Yes, the jerky movements were brief, lasting just a few seconds. I recovered immediately and felt completely clear-headed after I came to.

No, I didn't experience any chest pain, palpitations, or shortness of breath before or after the episode. I felt fine once I regained consciousness.

Did you feel nauseated or have blurred vision, ringing in ears, or tunnel vision before fainting?

No, I didn't feel nauseated, and I didn't have any blurred vision, ringing in my ears, or tunnel vision before I fainted. I just felt really sweaty and pale.

Did you have any jerking of limbs or stiffening, or was it more of a brief slump?

Yes, there were some jerky movements of my arms and legs for a few seconds while I was out. It felt like my body was shaking involuntarily.

Were the jerks brief (under 15 seconds) and did you recover immediately without confusion?

Yes, the jerky movements were brief, lasting just a few seconds. I recovered immediately and felt completely clear-headed after I came to.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Genitourinary syndrome of menopause (vulvovaginal atrophy)
doctor_hist:
Hello, how long have the itching and discomfort been going on?

It's been about a year now. The itching is really severe, and I've also started having pain during intercourse.

Have you noticed any white patches, skin thinning, tearing, or scarring on the vulva?

No, I haven't noticed any white patches, skin thinning, or scarring. Just a lot of itching and discomfort during intercourse.

Have you noticed any unusual discharge, odor, or burning with urination?

No, I haven't had any unusual discharge or odor, and there's no burning when I urinate. It’s mainly just the itching and the pain during sex.

Have you tried any new soaps, detergents, pads, lubricants, or products on the area?

I’ve only tried over-the-counter lubricants, but they haven’t helped at all. I haven't changed any soaps or detergents recently.

Have you noticed any small bumps, ulcers, or a rash on the vulva or perineum?

No, I haven't noticed any bumps, ulcers, or any kind of rash. Just persistent itching and pain during intercourse.

Have you reached menopause or noticed vaginal dryness?

Yes, I reached menopause about eight years ago, and I've definitely noticed more dryness since then. It seems to have contributed to the discomfort during intercourse.

Have you had any postmenopausal bleeding or spotting?

No, I haven’t had any postmenopausal bleeding or spotting. Everything seems to be normal in that regard.

Have you tried any treatments like vaginal moisturizers, topical estrogen, or corticosteroid creams?

I haven't tried any vaginal moisturizers or topical treatments. I was hoping the lubricants would help, but they didn't make a difference.

Have you noticed any skin color changes or figure‑of‑eight pattern irritation around the vulva and anus?

No, I haven't noticed any skin color changes or any specific patterns of irritation. It's really just the severe itching and the pain during intercourse that I've been dealing with.

Have you had any new sexual partners, history of STIs, or recent antibiotic use?

No, I haven't had any new sexual partners, and I don’t have a history of STIs. I also haven't taken any antibiotics recently.

Have you noticed vaginal itching internally or primarily on the external vulvar skin?

It's primarily the external vulvar skin that itches. I haven't really noticed any internal itching.

Have you noticed any skin cracking, fissures, or pain with tight clothing or wiping?

No, I haven't noticed any skin cracking or fissures. Tight clothing or wiping doesn’t seem to cause any additional pain; it’s mainly just the itching and discomfort during intercourse.

Have you noticed that symptoms worsen at night or disturb your sleep?

I haven't noticed that the symptoms worsen at night, but they can be pretty bothersome throughout the day. Sleep hasn't been too affected, thankfully.

Have you noticed reduced elasticity or narrowing at the vaginal opening making penetration difficult?

No, I haven't noticed any reduced elasticity or narrowing at the vaginal opening. It’s mainly the severe vulvar itching and pain during penetration that’s the issue.

Do you have any history of eczema, psoriasis, or other skin conditions?

No, I don't have any history of eczema, psoriasis, or other skin conditions. My skin has generally been healthy aside from this itching and discomfort.

Do you apply any panty liners, wear synthetic/tight underwear, or use scented products on the vulvar area?

I do wear cotton underwear most of the time, but I occasionally use panty liners. I don't use any scented products on the vulvar area, though.

Do symptoms improve with regular use of vaginal moisturizers or avoidance of panty liners?

I haven't tried vaginal moisturizers yet, so I don't know if that would help. I usually avoid panty liners, but it hasn't made a significant difference when I use them. The itching is still pretty severe regardless.

REQUEST TEST: Vulvar_Exam_with_Vaginal_pH_and_Wet_Mount (inspect vulva; assess atrophy, erythema, excoriations; measure pH; microscopy for yeast/clue cells)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Bacillus cereus (emetic-type) food poisoning from reheated rice
doctor_hist:
When did your symptoms start, and what are they (nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, abdominal pain)?

The symptoms started about two hours ago. I have abdominal cramps, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, but I don’t have a fever.

What did you eat and drink in the last 24 hours, including any undercooked meats, dairy, seafood, or buffet foods?

I ate reheated food from earlier in the day. I can't recall anything undercooked or anything from a buffet. Just some leftovers from lunch, really.

Did anyone else who ate the same leftovers get sick?

I haven’t spoken to anyone else about it, but I didn’t notice anyone else getting sick. I’m mostly concerned about how I’m feeling right now.

Have you had many episodes of vomiting or diarrhea, and are you able to keep fluids down?

I've had a few episodes of vomiting and diarrhea. Right now, it's tough to keep fluids down. I feel pretty nauseous.

Have you noticed any blood in your vomit or stools?

I haven't seen any blood in my vomit or stools. It's just been mostly clear or yellowish. I'm really just trying to manage the nausea.

Any recent travel, antibiotic use, or chronic illnesses?

I haven’t traveled recently, and I haven’t taken any antibiotics. I don’t have any chronic illnesses either; I'm generally healthy.

Any severe dehydration signs: dizziness on standing, very dry mouth, little or no urination?

I've felt a bit dizzy when I stand up, and my mouth is pretty dry. I haven't noticed much urine output either.

Have you had any fever, chills, or severe constant abdominal pain (not just cramps)?

I haven't had any fever or chills, but the abdominal cramps can be quite intense at times. It's really uncomfortable, and I'm just trying to find a way to feel better.

Have you eaten any creamy sauces, custards, mayo-based salads, or reheated rice earlier today?

I had some reheated food, but I don’t remember any creamy sauces or mayo-based dishes. Just some rice with leftovers, I think.

Did the rice sit at room temperature for several hours before reheating, and how long after eating did symptoms begin?

The rice did sit out for a while before I reheated it. My symptoms started about an hour after I ate.

Any tingling around the mouth, weakness, or neurological symptoms (blurry vision, double vision)?

I haven't experienced any tingling around my mouth or any weakness. No neurological symptoms like blurry or double vision either. Just the nausea and cramps are really bothering me.

Any recent shellfish consumption or fish that tasted unusual?

I haven't had any shellfish or unusual-tasting fish lately. Just the leftovers I mentioned before. Nothing out of the ordinary with my meals.

Any pregnancy possibility or are you currently pregnant?

I'm not pregnant, and there’s no possibility of that. I'm a male college student, so that wouldn’t apply to me.

Any severe headache, stiff neck, or rash?

I haven't had any severe headache, stiff neck, or rash. I'm really just focused on the abdominal cramps and nausea.

Any known food allergies or history of similar episodes after reheated rice?

I don't have any known food allergies, and I haven't experienced similar episodes after reheated rice before. This is the first time I've felt this way.

Have you taken any medications for nausea or pain, or tried oral rehydration yet?

I haven't taken any medications for nausea or pain yet. I've been trying to drink some water, but it's hard to keep it down.

Have you had a very rapid onset (within 1–6 hours) of repeated vomiting more than diarrhea?

Yes, the onset was quite rapid, starting just about an hour after I ate. I've had more vomiting than diarrhea, actually. It's been a really rough couple of hours.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Bacillus cereus (emetic-type) food poisoning from reheated rice

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Chronic granulomatous disease (CGD)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the skin lesions (pus-filled boils, cold abscesses, eczema-like, or ulcers)?

"They look like big red bumps, and some have a lot of pus. They sometimes hurt a little."

Have you lost your baby teeth late or have very frequent bone/joint infections?

"I haven't lost any teeth yet, and I don't really have any joint pains or infections."

Do you get severe lung infections with large cavities or pneumatocele formation?

"I do get sick often, but I haven’t had any big holes in my lungs. Just lots of coughing and fevers sometimes."

Any history of delayed umbilical cord separation or very late healing after cuts?

"I don't remember my belly button, but I do seem to get booboos that take a long time to heal."

Do you get frequent ear or sinus infections and have very high white blood cell counts during infections?

"I get colds a lot, and sometimes my ears hurt, but I don’t know about my blood. I just feel really tired when I'm sick."

REQUEST TEST: CBC_with_differential_and_absolute_neutrophil_count

RESULTS: - **Vital Signs:** - Temperature: 38°C (100.4°F) - Blood Pressure: 100/60 mm Hg - Heart Rate: 100/min - **Complete Blood Count:** - WBC: Elevated with left shift - Hemoglobin: Within normal limits - Platelets: Within normal limits - **Immune Function:** - Nitroblue Tetrazolium Test (NBT): Abnormal - Neutrophil Oxidative Burst Activity: Decreased - **Dermatological Examination:** Several raised, erythematous lesions with pus over the face, neck, groins, and extremities. - **Lymphatic Examination:** Enlarged cervical and axillary lymph nodes bilaterally.

REQUEST TEST: Genetic_Test_for_CYBB_and_other_CGD_genes

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Dihydrorhodamine_123_flow_cytometry (DHR) for neutrophil oxidative burst

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Serum_IgE_level_and_eosinophil_count

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do you have a history of severe infections with catalase-positive organisms like Staph aureus or Serratia?

"I get sick a lot, and sometimes the doctors say I have staph infections. I don't know much about the names, but I keep getting these skin bumps."

Have you ever had deep-seated abscesses that are not very red or warm (“cold abscesses”) or very itchy eczema-like rashes?

"I haven't had any cold abscesses, and my bumps aren't really itchy like eczema. They just feel sore sometimes."

Have you ever had unusual infections with Aspergillus or Burkholderia, or needed IV antibiotics for recurrent deep infections?

"I haven't had any weird infections like that, and I don’t remember needing IV antibiotics. I just usually get better with regular medicine."

Have you had delayed separation of your umbilical cord beyond 3 weeks after birth or very few pus cells in wound drainage noted by doctors?

"I don’t know about my belly button, but my cuts seem to have more pus when I get them."

Do you have frequent oral ulcers, severe gingivitis, or very few/no neutrophils seen on smears during infections?

"I don't have mouth sores or gum problems, but I do feel yucky when I get sick. I don't know about the neutrophils."

Do symptoms worsen in infancy with severe infections starting soon after birth?

"I got really sick a lot when I was little, but I don’t remember all the details. My caregiver says I’ve always had some skin bumps."

Have you ever had severe periodontitis or loss of teeth support at a young age?

"I haven't lost any teeth yet, and my gums seem okay. I just see the dentist, and they say everything looks fine."

REQUEST TEST: Flow_cytometry_for_CXCR4_expression_and_APC_marker_on_leukocytes

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do you have chronic diarrhea, bloating, or greasy stools suggesting malabsorption?

"I don’t have tummy troubles or anything like that. My belly feels okay most of the time."

DIAGNOSIS READY: Chronic granulomatous disease (CGD)

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Rotator cuff tendinopathy (subacromial impingement) with concurrent viral gastroenteritis
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the right arm pain (onset, location, character, severity, what triggers/relieves)?

The pain started a few days ago and is mainly in the upper part of my right arm. It feels like a sharp ache, and I'd rate it around a 7 out of 10. Lifting my arm makes it worse, but resting helps a bit.

Any injury, overuse, or recent heavy lifting with that arm?

No, I haven't had any recent injuries or heavy lifting. I haven't done anything out of the ordinary with my arm.

Any numbness, tingling, weakness, neck pain, or pain radiating from neck to the arm?

I haven't noticed any numbness or tingling, but there is some weakness when I try to lift it. No neck pain or radiating pain either.

Any swelling, redness, warmth, or visible deformity in the right shoulder/upper arm?

No swelling, redness, or warmth that I can see, and my arm doesn’t look deformed. It just feels really painful when I move it.

Any recent fever, chest pain, shortness of breath, dizziness, or sweating with the pain?

No, I haven't had any fever, chest pain, or shortness of breath. I don’t feel dizzy or sweaty either; it’s just mainly the arm pain and some nausea.

Have you had vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, or blood in stool?

I've had diarrhea and some vague, diffuse abdominal tenderness, but I haven't noticed any blood in my stool. No vomiting either, just nausea.

Have you had any recent infections, new medications, unusual foods, or travel?

No recent infections or new medications. I haven't eaten anything unusual or traveled anywhere recently either.

Any history of gallbladder disease, right upper abdominal pain after fatty meals, or pain radiating to the right shoulder?

I don’t have any history of gallbladder disease, and I haven't noticed any specific pain after eating fatty meals. The pain doesn’t really radiate to my shoulder either; it’s just localized in my arm.

Have you noticed any recent rashes, tick bites, or insect bites before the symptoms started?

No, I haven’t noticed any rashes or insect bites at all. Everything seemed normal before the symptoms started.

Any prior similar episodes of arm pain with GI upset, and what was the diagnosis then?

Yes, I've had similar episodes in the past year with arm pain and GI issues. However, I didn't receive a specific diagnosis; they just treated the symptoms.

Have you noticed pain when abducting the shoulder or reaching overhead, and is there pain at night when lying on that side?

Yes, I do feel pain when I try to lift my arm to the side, and it sometimes bothers me at night when I'm lying on that side. It makes it hard to find a comfortable position to sleep.

Do you feel a painful arc between about 60–120 degrees of arm abduction?

Yes, I do feel pain when my arm is in that range. It's quite uncomfortable and makes me want to stop moving my arm altogether.

Do you have pain with resisted shoulder abduction or external rotation?

Yes, I do feel pain when my doctor tries to resist me lifting my arm to the side or rotating it outward. It really amplifies the discomfort.

REQUEST TEST: Shoulder_Ultrasound (right)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Shoulder_MRI (right)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Shoulder_X-Ray (right)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do you have tenderness over the lateral shoulder (subacromial area) or over the bicipital groove in the front?

I do feel some tenderness in the front of my shoulder, but it’s more intense over the lateral side. It’s pretty sensitive to the touch in both areas.

Do overhead activities or repetitive motions at work aggravate it?

I don't have a job that requires overhead activities or repetitive motions. My daily activities are pretty normal and don’t involve much strain on my arms.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Moderate COPD (emphysema-predominant) with unexplained weight loss
doctor_hist:
Can you describe your cough—dry or with phlegm, any blood?

I don’t have a cough at all. Just a lot of trouble catching my breath lately, and I've noticed some weight loss.

Have you ever smoked or been exposed to dust, chemicals, or asbestos?

Yes, I’ve been an active smoker for many years, and I worked in construction and a steel mill during my youth. I’m not sure about other exposures, though.

Have you had chest pain, leg swelling, wheezing, or fevers?

No chest pain or leg swelling, and I haven’t felt any fevers. I also haven’t experienced wheezing. Just the shortness of breath and the weight loss.

Have you noticed hoarseness, difficulty swallowing, or night sweats?

No hoarseness or difficulty swallowing, and I haven't had any night sweats. It's really just the shortness of breath and the weight loss that are concerning me.

REQUEST TEST: Chest_X-Ray

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Spirometry_with_Bronchodilator

RESULTS: FEV1/FVC Ratio: 60%, FEV1: 50% of predicted value, Total Lung Capacity: 110% of predicted value, Residual Volume: 115% of predicted value, DLCO: 60% of predicted value.

Do you get short of breath at rest or mainly with exertion, and has it been progressively worsening?

It's mainly with exertion, but it seems to have been getting worse even when I'm at rest lately. I've really noticed it more over the past year.

Do you have ankle swelling, chest tightness, or episodes of waking at night short of breath?

No ankle swelling or chest tightness, and I don't wake up at night feeling short of breath. It's primarily during the day when I'm active or even just sitting sometimes.

Have you noticed increased phlegm, chronic morning cough in the past, or frequent bronchitis episodes?

I haven't noticed any increased phlegm or chronic cough, and I haven't had frequent bronchitis episodes either. It's really just the shortness of breath and the weight loss that have been my main issues.

Do you have a history of asthma, allergies, or autoimmune disease?

I don't have any history of asthma, allergies, or autoimmune diseases. It's just the ongoing shortness of breath and weight loss that's been troubling me.

Have you noticed swelling, pain, or tenderness in your calves, or sudden worsening of breath with pleuritic chest pain?

No swelling or pain in my calves, and I haven't experienced any chest pain, not even when breathing. It's really just the shortness of breath and the weight loss that I'm dealing with.

Have you experienced palpitations, dizziness, or fainting spells?

No, I haven't had any palpitations, dizziness, or fainting spells. It's just the persistent shortness of breath and the weight loss that I'm focused on.

REQUEST TEST: High-Resolution_CT_Chest

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Have you been tested for alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency or have early-onset lung disease in family?

I haven't been tested for alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency, and there's no family history of early-onset lung disease that I know of. It's mainly just my own issues with shortness of breath and weight loss.

Do you have exertional chest pressure or known coronary artery disease?

No, I don't have exertional chest pressure, and I don't have a history of coronary artery disease either. My main concerns continue to be the shortness of breath and the weight loss.

Do you have swelling or pain in finger joints, skin rashes, or Raynaud’s (color changes in fingers with cold)?

No swelling or pain in my finger joints, no skin rashes, and I've never noticed any color changes in my fingers with the cold. It's really just the breathing issues and weight loss that are weighing on my mind.

Have you had your heart evaluated—any heart murmur, previous echocardiogram, or history of blood clots?

I haven't had my heart evaluated or any echocardiograms done. No known heart murmurs or history of blood clots either. My primary concern remains with the shortness of breath and the weight loss.

REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Arterial_Blood_Gas (on room air)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGSThis is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: First-episode psychosis, likely schizophreniform disorder
doctor_hist:
When did the personality and behavior changes start, and how quickly did they progress?

It all started about seven months ago, and it has gotten worse really quickly. I used to be outgoing, but now I hardly leave the house.

Have you had memory loss, confusion, or trouble concentrating?

I've noticed I'm having trouble focusing on things and my thoughts feel jumbled. It’s hard to remember simple things sometimes.

Have you had visual hallucinations, strange sleep behaviors, or episodes of acting out dreams?

No, I haven’t seen anything unusual or had strange dreams, but I do feel really anxious and on edge most of the time. I can't shake this feeling that something is wrong.

Have you had headaches, seizures, fainting, weakness, numbness, or changes in speech or movement?

I haven't had any headaches or seizures, but I do sometimes feel weak and a bit numb. My speech has been fine, but I struggle to express my thoughts clearly.

Have you had any fevers, weight loss, night sweats, or recent infections?

I haven’t had any fevers or night sweats, and I’m not experiencing any infections. My weight has been about the same, but I feel less motivated to eat lately.

Have you used alcohol or drugs recently, or started any new medications or supplements?

I haven't used alcohol or drugs recently; I quit smoking marijuana about a year ago. I’m not on any new medications or supplements either.

Have you noticed unusual movements (twitches, jerks), balance problems, or new clumsiness?

I haven't noticed any unusual movements or balance problems, but sometimes I feel unsteady when I’m walking. I just feel a bit off overall, like I’m not really in control.

REQUEST TEST: MRI_Brain_with_and_without_contrast

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Have you had any recent travel, tick bites, new rashes, or exposure to chemicals or heavy metals?

I haven’t traveled recently or had any tick bites. No rashes or exposure to chemicals that I can think of either. I mostly stay at home.

Have you or your family noticed rapid mood swings, paranoia, or delusions?

I've definitely been feeling paranoid, especially about the idea that aliens are watching me. My family has mentioned that I seem different, and I sometimes have these thoughts that just don't let go.

Have you had any suicidal thoughts or thoughts of harming others?

I haven't thought about hurting myself or anyone else, but I do feel really overwhelmed and hopeless sometimes. It’s just like everything feels too much to handle.

Have you had any prior psychiatric diagnoses or family history of mental illness (e.g., bipolar, schizophrenia)?

I haven't been diagnosed with anything before, and as far as I know, there isn't any family history of mental illness. But I feel like something is definitely off with me now.

Have you had any recent head trauma, new headaches, or changes in vision?

I haven't had any head trauma or changes in vision, and I don't get headaches. Everything just feels foggy and confusing in my mind.

Have you been having trouble with sleep (falling or staying asleep), or sleeping much more than usual?

I’ve been having trouble falling asleep and staying asleep. I often lie awake at night, my mind racing with thoughts. I feel so tired during the day but can't seem to rest properly.

Have you experienced hearing voices or sounds that others don’t hear?

I haven't heard any voices, but I do feel like I'm constantly being watched. It's really unsettling and makes me anxious all the time.

Have you used stimulants (e.g., amphetamines) or experienced high caffeine/energy drink intake recently?

I haven’t used any stimulants or high caffeine drinks; I mostly just stay at home and don't really consume much. I just feel jumpy and restless all the time.

Have you had any changes in menstrual cycles, thyroid issues, or other hormone problems?

I don't have any menstrual cycles, obviously, and I haven't experienced any thyroid issues. Hormone problems haven't been something I've noticed either.

Have you used steroids or experienced high stress, insomnia, or jet lag before symptoms worsened?

I haven't used steroids, and I don't think I've had any significant stress. The insomnia started when everything changed, and it just keeps getting worse.

REQUEST TEST: Urine_Toxicology_Screen

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGSThis is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Tetralogy of Fallot
doctor_hist:
Hello, what symptoms is your child having (e.g., cyanosis, shortness of breath, poor feeding, sweating, fainting)?

She's been really fussy and gets pale sometimes. Sometimes her lips look a bit blue, too.

When did the blue lips and pallor start, and do they worsen with feeding or crying?

The blue lips and paleness started about a few weeks ago. They can get worse when she’s crying, but I haven’t noticed it changing with feeding.

Any episodes of breathing fast, tiring easily, or sweating with feeds or at rest?

No, she hasn't been breathing fast or sweating, and she seems to have normal energy when she's playing.

Have you noticed any episodes of fainting, dizziness, or your child squatting during play?

I haven't noticed any fainting or dizziness, and she doesn’t seem to squat during play. She just gets really cranky sometimes.

Has there been poor weight gain or trouble feeding since birth?

No, she hasn't had any trouble feeding, and her weight seems to be okay. She eats and drinks normally.

REQUEST TEST: Pulse_oximetry_with_pre- and post-ductal_readings

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Any heart murmur, rapid heartbeat, or abnormal pulses noted at checkups?

Yes, she was previously diagnosed with a heart murmur, but it wasn't investigated further.

Has she ever turned blue all over or had episodes of bluish hands/feet that improve when she’s warm?

No, she hasn’t turned blue all over, and her hands and feet look normal most of the time. They don’t seem to get blue with cold, either.

Any noisy breathing, snoring, or mouth-breathing, or spells of breath-holding when upset?

No noisy breathing or snoring, and she doesn't breathe through her mouth. I haven’t noticed her holding her breath when she gets upset either.

REQUEST TEST: Physical_exam_with_cardiac_auscultation_and_four-limb_BP_pulses

RESULTS: - **Vital Signs**: - Temperature: 36.8°C (98.2°F) - Blood Pressure: 95/58 mmHg - Heart Rate: 110 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 22 breaths/min - **Cardiovascular Examination**: - Inspection: The child assumes a squatting position when distressed. - Palpation: Normal pulse in upper and lower extremities, no significant difference in pulse amplitude. - Auscultation: Harsh, systolic ejection murmur best heard at the upper left sternal border. No diastolic murmur noted. - **Other Examinations**: - **Pulmonary Examination**: - Inspection and Palpation: No use of accessory muscles. Symmetric chest expansion. - Auscultation: Clear lung fields bilaterally, no wheezes, crackles, or rhonchi. - **Extremities**: - Inspection: No cyanosis, clubbing, or edema.

That squatting detail is important—how often does she squat during distress or play?

She doesn’t squat all the time, but when she gets really upset, it happens a few times a day. It seems to help her feel better when she's cranky.

REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram_with_Doppler

RESULTS: **Echocardiogram Findings**: Ventricular septal defect, pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, and right ventricular hypertrophy consistent with Tetralogy of Fallot.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Severe thrombocytopenia in pregnancy due to dengue-like viral infection versus acute viral hemorrhagic fever; most likely dengue with negative early/serologic tests but clinical-compatible thrombocytopenia and petechiae after Sri Lanka travel
doctor_hist:
Where did you travel recently and when did you return?

I returned from a camping trip to Sri Lanka about a month ago.

Any rash, muscle/joint pain, or behind-the-eyes pain since returning?

I haven't had any rash, but I do have a persistent headache and some abdominal discomfort. No muscle or joint pain, and my eyes feel fine.

Have you had any episodes of bleeding elsewhere (nosebleeds, easy bruising, black stools, or blood in urine) or noticed yellowing of your eyes/skin?

I’ve noticed my gums bleed while brushing my teeth, and I have mild yellowing of my eyes. No nosebleeds or any other bleeding, though.

Have you had high fever measured, and if so, what was the highest temperature and when did it start?

I've had a fever, and it reached about 102°F. It started about a week ago.

Have you noticed reduced urine output, dark urine, or severe weakness/fainting?

I haven't noticed any changes in my urine output, but I do feel a bit weaker than usual. No dark urine or fainting episodes, though.

REQUEST TEST: CBC_with_platelets, LFTs, Dengue_NS1_and_IgM, Malaria_rapid_test_and_thick_thin_smears, Urinalysis, Coagulation_panel (PT/INR, aPTT), Pregnancy_ultrasound

RESULTS: - **Vital Signs**: - Temperature: 39.3°C (102.8°F) - Blood Pressure: 135/88 mm Hg - Heart Rate: 104/min - Respiratory Rate: 24/min - **General Examination**: - Skin: Pallor and mild scleral icterus noted, with a few scattered petechiae over the trunk and back. - HEENT: Bleeding gums noted upon inspection, no lymphadenopathy. - Abdominal Examination: Soft, non-tender, no organomegaly detected. - **Laboratory Studies**: - Hemoglobin: 8.2 g/dL - Leukocyte Count: 10,000/mm³ - Platelet Count: 18,000/mm³ - INR: 1.0 - Coomb's Test: Negative - Fibrin Split Products: Negative - **Serum**: - Urea: 20 mg/dL - Creatinine: 1.1 mg/dL - Bilirubin Total: 3.0 mg/dL - Bil

Your LFT result was cut off—what are the AST, ALT, and direct bilirubin values?

I'm sorry, I don't have the specific values for AST, ALT, and direct bilirubin at the moment. However, I know my total bilirubin was 3.0 mg/dL.

REQUEST TEST: Repeat_LFTs_including_AST_ALT_Alk_Phos_Direct_bilirubin

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Have you had any mosquito bites during or after your Sri Lanka trip?

I did have quite a few mosquito bites while I was in Sri Lanka; they were pretty bad.

Have you had any episodes of severe abdominal pain, vomiting, or bleeding from the nose/vagina?

I haven't had any severe abdominal pain or vomiting, but I've noticed some bleeding from my gums. No bleeding from my nose or vagina, though.

Have you noticed any new shortness of breath, chest pain, or severe fatigue beyond your usual?

I haven't experienced any shortness of breath or chest pain. I do feel more fatigued than usual, though, which has been concerning.

Have you had any diarrhea, black stools, or blood in stool?

I haven't had any diarrhea or black stools, and I haven’t noticed any blood in my stool either.

Any severe muscle or joint pain, or pain behind the eyes that worsens with eye movement?

I haven't had any severe muscle or joint pain, and my eyes feel normal without any pain behind them. My headache has just been persistent.

Have you had any recent tick bites, animal exposures, or wading in freshwater during the camping trip?

I haven't had any recent tick bites or animal exposures. I did wade in some freshwater while camping, but I didn't notice any issues at the time.

Have you had any black urine or tea-colored urine, or noticed yellowing worsening after the fever?

I haven't noticed any black or tea-colored urine, and the yellowing of my eyes has been mild and hasn't really worsened since the fever started. I'm mostly just feeling weak and tired.

Do you recall your exact gestational age and any prior pregnancy complications?

I'm currently 12 weeks pregnant and this is my first pregnancy, so no prior complications to mention.

Have you had any recent aspirin/NSAID use or herbal supplements?

I haven't taken any aspirin or NSAIDs recently, and I don't use any herbal supplements either. Just sticking to my prenatal vitamins.

REQUEST TEST: Dengue_NS1_repeat_and_Dengue_IgM/IgG_with_tourniquet_test_and_ultrasound_for_plasma_leak (FAST)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Repeat_Malaria_smears_q12h_x3_with_RDT, Leptospira_IgM_and_PCR, Peripheral_blood_film_for_schistocytes_and_hemolysis_panel (LDH,haptoglobin,retic)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGSThis is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

doctor_hist:
Can you tell me when the confusion and abdominal pain started?

"It's been happening for a few days now. The confusion seems to come and go, and the pain in my abdomen feels worse sometimes."

Where exactly is the abdominal pain located (upper right, upper left, lower right, lower left, or all over)?

"It’s mostly in the upper right area. It sometimes feels like a dull ache, but other times it’s sharper."

Have you noticed fever, yellowing of your skin/eyes, dark urine, or pale stools?

"I've been feeling a bit warm; I think I might have a fever. No yellowing of my skin or eyes, and I haven't noticed any changes in urine or stool color."

Have you had nausea, vomiting, or loss of appetite?

"I haven't really felt like eating lately, and there were a couple of times I felt a bit nauseous, but no vomiting."

Have you had any alcohol recently, new medications, or extra doses of pain pills like acetaminophen?

"I haven't had any alcohol recently. I'm not sure about new medications, but I do take my regular meds. I don’t think I've taken extra doses of anything."

Any history of gallstones, prior gallbladder problems, or right shoulder blade pain after fatty meals?

"I don’t recall having gallstones or any previous gallbladder issues. I haven't felt any shoulder pain after eating, but I haven't been eating much lately."

Have you noticed confusion worsening at night or with dehydration, and are you more sleepy than usual?

"It's hard to tell if it's worse at night, but I do feel more tired than usual. Sometimes, just sitting still makes me feel a bit out of it."

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Progressive macular hypomelanosis
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the lesions—are they flat patches or scaly spots?

They are flat patches on my skin, and they feel smooth. No scales or roughness at all.

Do the patches become more noticeable after sun exposure or tanning?

I haven't really noticed any significant change after sun exposure, but they do seem to stand out more compared to the surrounding skin.

Do you have any numbness over the patches or reduced sensation to touch/temperature?

No, I haven't experienced any numbness or changes in sensation over the patches. They feel normal to me.

Any itching, pain, or burning in the patches?

No, there's no itching, pain, or burning at all. They just feel like normal skin.

Have you noticed similar patches on others in your household or close contacts?

No, I haven't noticed similar patches on anyone else I know, except for my father who has a similar condition.

Do the patches have sharply defined borders or are they more faint and blending into normal skin?

They have fairly sharply defined borders and are quite distinct from the surrounding normal skin.

Do you have any loss of hair, eyebrow involvement, or patches of white hair (poliosis) over the areas?

No, I haven't noticed any hair loss or white patches of hair in those areas. The hair seems to be normal.

Have the patches started as small spots that gradually enlarged, and are they fully depigmented (chalk-white) or just lighter than your skin?

Yes, the patches started as smaller spots that have gradually enlarged. They’re definitely lighter than my normal skin, but not completely chalk-white.

Do the lesions fluoresce under Wood’s lamp (blue-white in vitiligo vs yellow/green in tinea versicolor)?

I haven't had a Wood's lamp test done yet, so I'm not sure if they fluoresce or not. I can ask about it if it would help.

REQUEST TEST: Woods_Lamp_Examination

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

Are the patches located mostly on sun-exposed areas (face, hands) or on the trunk/upper arms?

They're mostly on my trunk and upper arms, with a few on my shoulders as well. Not much on my face or hands.

Any history of atopic dermatitis, asthma, or allergies?

I don’t have any history of atopic dermatitis, asthma, or allergies. I've been generally healthy and haven’t had any significant issues.

Any history of preceding inflammation, injury, or rash at those sites before they lightened?

No, I haven't had any inflammation, injury, or rash at those sites before they lightened. They just started appearing out of nowhere.

Any scaling appears if you gently scratch the patches (evoked scale)?

I haven't noticed any scaling, even when I gently scratch the patches. They remain smooth to the touch.

Do the borders show a faint, slightly darker rim (hyperpigmented border) around the lighter patches?

No, I haven't seen any darker rim around the patches. The borders are sharply defined without any hyperpigmentation.

Any new patches appearing or existing ones expanding over the last 3 months?

Yes, I have noticed a couple of new patches appearing over the last three months, and the existing ones have expanded a bit as well.

Do you have a personal or family history of autoimmune diseases (thyroid disease, type 1 diabetes, pernicious anemia)?

No, I don't have any personal history of autoimmune diseases, but my father has similar skin issues. I'm not aware of any other autoimmune conditions in my family.

Have you noticed patches on mucous membranes (lips, genitals) or around body openings?

No, I haven't noticed any patches on my mucous membranes or around any body openings. They’re all located on my skin.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Pseudomonas aeruginosa microbial keratitis (corneal ulcer) in the right eye
doctor_hist:
Can you tell me which eye is affected and when the symptoms began?

My right eye is the one that's affected. The symptoms started just yesterday.

Any light sensitivity, halos, or seeing rainbow colors?

I haven’t noticed any halos or rainbow colors, but there is definitely some light sensitivity. It hurts more in bright light.

Any redness, tearing, or discharge from the right eye?

I haven't seen any redness or discharge, but my right eye feels a bit scratchy and may be watery at times.

Any history of contact lens use, eye trauma, or something getting into the eye?

I've been using contact lenses regularly, but there hasn't been any trauma or anything getting into my eye recently.

Do you sleep in your contacts or wear them longer than recommended?

No, I don’t sleep in my contacts, and I typically follow the recommended wear time. I clean and store them properly as well.

Any change in vision clarity or sudden decrease in visual acuity in the right eye?

Yes, I've noticed that my vision is blurry in the right eye, and it feels like it's getting worse. It’s really difficult to focus on things.

Any floaters, flashes of light, or a curtain over your vision?

I haven't seen any floaters or flashes of light, and there’s no curtain effect over my vision. It's just the blurriness and pain that's causing the most concern.

Any headache, nausea, or vomiting?

I haven't had any headaches, nausea, or vomiting at all. It's just the pain and blurry vision in my right eye that's bothering me.

Have you noticed localized eye tenderness, a small white spot on the cornea, or a feeling of something in the eye?

I haven't noticed any localized eye tenderness or a small white spot on my cornea. It just feels like there's something irritating in there, but I can't pinpoint it.

REQUEST TEST: Slit_Lamp_with_Fluorescein_Staining_and_Corneal_Scraping_Culture

RESULTS: - **Vital Signs**: - Temperature: 37.0°C (98.6°F) - Blood Pressure: 135/75 mmHg - Heart Rate: 85 bpm - Respiratory Rate: Normal - **Ophthalmic Examination**: - Visual Acuity: - Right Eye: Count fingers at 3 feet - Left Eye: 20/25 - Inspection: Right eye appears red with evident discomfort on opening. - Palpation: No abnormalities noted. - **Slit Lamp Examination**: - Findings: Corneal ulceration with infiltration, indicating microbial keratitis. - **Microbiology**: - Corneal Scraping Culture: Growth of Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Functional dyspepsia (epigastric pain syndrome)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the pain (burning, gnawing, sharp) and its timing in relation to meals?

The pain feels like a gnawing sensation, and it tends to start a few hours after I eat. It can be quite intense at times, especially if I've had a larger meal.

Any relief with eating, antacids, or vomiting, and does it wake you at night?

The pain doesn't really go away with eating or antacids, and I haven't experienced any vomiting. It doesn't usually wake me up at night, though.

Do you use NSAIDs (ibuprofen/naproxen) or drink alcohol regularly?

No, I don’t use NSAIDs, and I don’t drink alcohol at all. I try to stay away from anything that might irritate my stomach.

Any red flags: unintentional weight loss, black/tarry stools, vomiting blood, anemia, dysphagia, or age >55?

I don’t have any unintentional weight loss, and I haven’t noticed any black or tarry stools. I also haven't experienced vomiting blood or difficulty swallowing.

Any nausea, bloating, or early fullness, and have you had similar episodes before?

I haven't had any nausea or bloating, and I don't feel overly full after eating. This is the first time I've experienced these episodes, though.

Any heartburn or sour taste/regurgitation?

No, I haven't experienced any heartburn or a sour taste in my mouth. There hasn't been any regurgitation either.

Do you have a history of H. pylori infection or close contacts with it?

I don't have a known history of H. pylori infection, and I’m not aware of any close contacts who do. I’ve never been tested for it before.

REQUEST TEST: H_pylori_Urea_Breath_Test

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: H_pylori_Stool_Antigen_Test

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Any recent travel, contaminated food exposure, or significant stress?

I haven't traveled recently, and I haven't had any exposure to contaminated food. Stress levels have been normal; I haven't experienced anything particularly significant lately.

Any family history of peptic ulcer disease, GI cancers, or inflammatory bowel disease?

Yes, my father had similar symptoms in the past, but I'm not sure if he was ever diagnosed with anything specific. Other than that, there's no known family history of GI cancers or inflammatory bowel disease.

Have you noticed any relation to spicy/fatty foods, caffeine, or smoking?

I haven't noticed a specific relation to spicy or fatty foods, but caffeine seems to make the pain a bit worse. I don’t smoke at all, so that hasn’t been a factor for me.

Does the pain improve with antacids or PPIs like omeprazole over a few days?

No, the pain hasn’t improved with antacids or PPIs like omeprazole. I’ve tried them for a few days, but they don’t seem to make a difference.

Have you had any unintentional weight loss or changes in appetite or energy?

I haven't had any unintentional weight loss, and my appetite has been normal. My energy levels are also consistent; I haven't noticed any significant changes.

Any fevers, jaundice, dark urine, or pale stools?

No, I haven't had any fevers, jaundice, or changes in urine or stool color. Everything looks normal in that regard.

Any back-radiating pain or relation to lying down (worse supine, better leaning forward)?

I haven’t noticed any back-radiating pain, and the position I’m in doesn't seem to make the pain worse or better. It’s mostly localized to my upper abdomen.

Any changes in bowel habits (diarrhea/constipation) or blood in stool?

I haven't experienced any changes in my bowel habits; everything has been regular. There's been no blood in my stool, either.

Any unintentional weight loss, loss of appetite, or early satiety?

I haven't had any unintentional weight loss, and my appetite is normal. I don't feel overly full after meals either.

Any recent new medications or supplements (including iron, potassium, bisphosphonates)?

I haven't started any new medications or supplements recently. I generally don't take anything other than the occasional multivitamin.This is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Patellofemoral pain syndrome with activity-related synovitis (right knee)
doctor_hist:
Where exactly is the knee pain (front, sides, behind), and is one or both knees affected?

The pain is mostly around the front and sides of my right knee. My left knee was swollen a few weeks ago, but it isn’t bothering me as much now.

Does the knee feel warm/red and is the swelling sudden or gradual?

The right knee feels a bit warm, and the swelling appeared rather suddenly. The left knee had some swelling too, but it improved gradually.

Any recent fever, chills, or feeling unwell?

No, I haven’t had any fever or chills. I’ve just been feeling frustrated with my mobility issues.

Any recent injury, twist, or overuse before the swelling started?

I can't recall any specific injury or twist, but I have been more active than usual lately, which might have contributed.

Have you had gout before, or noticed sudden attacks of severe joint pain in the big toe or other joints?

I haven't had gout before, and I haven't noticed any sudden attacks of severe pain in my toe or other joints. My pain is more consistent and located around my knee.

Have you noticed morning stiffness lasting over 30 minutes or joints in your hands/wrists also aching or swelling?

I haven't noticed morning stiffness lasting over 30 minutes. My hands and wrists feel fine, just the knee and some persistent back pain.

Have you had any recent tick bites or a rash, or traveled to areas with Lyme disease?

I haven’t had any recent tick bites or noticed any rashes. I haven't traveled to areas known for Lyme disease either.

Have you had any prior joint fluid drained or tested from either knee, or previous knee infections?

No, I haven't had any joint fluid drained or tested from either knee, and I haven't experienced any knee infections in the past.

REQUEST TEST: Knee_Aspiration_with_Cell_Count_Gram_Stain_Crystals_Culture (right knee)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

Do you have a history of osteoarthritis in your knees or prior imaging showing knee joint degeneration?

I was diagnosed with arthritis about 16 years ago, but I haven't had any recent imaging done. I know my right knee has been bothering me more lately, though.

Have you had any episodes where the knee locks, catches, or gives way?

I haven't experienced any locking or catching in my knee, but there are times when it feels unstable and gives way a bit when I try to walk.

Have you noticed swelling or pain in your Achilles, heels, bottom of the feet, or had any recent eye redness?

I haven't noticed any swelling or pain in my Achilles, heels, or the bottom of my feet. My eyes haven't been red either.

Have you noticed swelling, tenderness, or pain at the front of the knee just below the kneecap (where the patellar tendon attaches)?

No, I haven't noticed any specific swelling or tenderness right below the kneecap. The pain is more generalized around the sides and front of the knee.

Have you had hip or groin pain, or pain radiating from the low back to the knee?

I haven’t had any hip or groin pain, but I do have persistent back pain that sometimes makes it harder to move around. It feels like the back pain contributes to my knee issues as well.

Does the knee swell more after activity and improve with rest?

Yes, the swelling in my right knee tends to get worse after I've been active. It definitely feels better when I rest for a while.

REQUEST TEST: Right_Knee_XRay_Weightbearing_AP_Lateral_Sunrise_View

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

Do your symptoms include frequent kneeling or direct pressure on the front of the knee at work or home?

I don't do a lot of kneeling or putting direct pressure on my knee. My activities mainly involve walking around and trying to stay active, but that seems to aggravate the pain.

Does the knee feel worse going downstairs or with squatting (suggesting patellofemoral pain)?

Going downstairs definitely makes the knee pain worse. Squatting is uncomfortable too, but it's mostly the stairs that aggravate it the most.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Patellofemoral pain syndrome with activity-related synovitis (right knee)
patient_hist:
Where exactly is the knee pain (front, sides, behind), and is one or both knees affected?

The pain is mostly around the front and sides of my right knee. My left knee was swollen a few weeks ago, but it isn’t bothering me as much now.

Does the knee feel warm/red and is the swelling sudden or gradual?

The right knee feels a bit warm, and the swelling appeared rather suddenly. The left knee had some swelling too, but it improved gradually.

Any recent fever, chills, or feeling unwell?

No, I haven’t had any fever or chills. I’ve just been feeling frustrated with my mobility issues.

Any recent injury, twist, or overuse before the swelling started?

I can't recall any specific injury or twist, but I have been more active than usual lately, which might have contributed.

Have you had gout before, or noticed sudden attacks of severe joint pain in the big toe or other joints?

I haven't had gout before, and I haven't noticed any sudden attacks of severe pain in my toe or other joints. My pain is more consistent and located around my knee.

Have you noticed morning stiffness lasting over 30 minutes or joints in your hands/wrists also aching or swelling?

I haven't noticed morning stiffness lasting over 30 minutes. My hands and wrists feel fine, just the knee and some persistent back pain.

Have you had any recent tick bites or a rash, or traveled to areas with Lyme disease?

I haven’t had any recent tick bites or noticed any rashes. I haven't traveled to areas known for Lyme disease either.

Have you had any prior joint fluid drained or tested from either knee, or previous knee infections?

No, I haven't had any joint fluid drained or tested from either knee, and I haven't experienced any knee infections in the past.

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

I was diagnosed with arthritis about 16 years ago, but I haven't had any recent imaging done. I know my right knee has been bothering me more lately, though.

Have you had any episodes where the knee locks, catches, or gives way?

I haven't experienced any locking or catching in my knee, but there are times when it feels unstable and gives way a bit when I try to walk.

Have you noticed swelling or pain in your Achilles, heels, bottom of the feet, or had any recent eye redness?

I haven't noticed any swelling or pain in my Achilles, heels, or the bottom of my feet. My eyes haven't been red either.

Have you noticed swelling, tenderness, or pain at the front of the knee just below the kneecap (where the patellar tendon attaches)?

No, I haven't noticed any specific swelling or tenderness right below the kneecap. The pain is more generalized around the sides and front of the knee.

Have you had hip or groin pain, or pain radiating from the low back to the knee?

I haven’t had any hip or groin pain, but I do have persistent back pain that sometimes makes it harder to move around. It feels like the back pain contributes to my knee issues as well.

Does the knee swell more after activity and improve with rest?

Yes, the swelling in my right knee tends to get worse after I've been active. It definitely feels better when I rest for a while.
