diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Ichthyosis vulgaris
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the appearance of the dry skin (fine scaling, thick scales, cracking) and where on your body it’s most prominent?

The dry skin generally looks like fine scales, and it's most prominent on my arms, legs, and torso. It's not really cracked, just a bit rough in places.

Do you have a family history of similar dry, scaly skin or early childhood eczema?

No, there's no similar skin condition in my family. My parents and sibling don't have any issues like this.

Do the scales spare your flexures and are they more noticeable on the shins with a “fish-scale” pattern?

Yes, the scales do spare the flexures, and I don't really see a “fish-scale” pattern on my shins. They just look like fine scales everywhere else.

Do hot showers or winter weather make it worse, and does it improve with humidity?

Hot showers and winter weather definitely make it worse for me. In the summer, when it's humid, it seems to feel a bit better.

Any associated symptoms like keratosis pilaris (rough bumps on upper arms/thighs) or palm/sole hyperlinearity?

Yes, I do have some rough bumps at the base of my hair follicles on my arms and thighs. My palms and soles also seem a bit darker in the creases.

Do you notice large, polygonal brown scales on the lower legs or fine white “powdery” scaling, and is there any body odor or heat intolerance?

I don’t see any large brown scales; just the fine white scales. There's no body odor or heat intolerance that I’ve noticed either.

Do you have a history of atopic conditions (asthma, allergic rhinitis, childhood eczema)?

No, I don't have any history of asthma, allergic rhinitis, or eczema. I've been healthy otherwise.

Any trouble with sweating (too little) or overheating during exercise?

No, I don't have any trouble with sweating or overheating when I exercise. I feel alright during physical activities.

Do you notice worse scaling on the extensor surfaces with relative sparing of the neck and popliteal/cubital fossae?

Yes, the scaling is worse on my arms and legs, especially on the outer surfaces. My neck and the back of my knees are not as affected.

Any history of premature birth or did your skin peel excessively as a newborn?

I wasn't born premature, and my skin didn't peel excessively as a newborn. Everything seemed normal back then.

Have your symptoms persisted year-round since early childhood without periods of complete clearing?

Yes, my symptoms have been there year-round since I was about six months old, and they never really go away completely. They just get a little better in the summer.

Do you have any eye issues (corneal problems), hearing loss, or neurologic symptoms?

No, I don’t have any eye problems, hearing loss, or any issues with my nerves. Everything seems fine in that way.

Any dark, prominent lines on palms/soles (hyperlinearity) or deep cracks there?

No deep cracks on my palms or soles, but I do notice that the lines in the creases are a bit darker than normal. It's mostly just the dryness that affects my skin overall.

Do you have any fine white scales on the scalp or involvement of the face?

I don't have any fine white scales on my scalp or involvement on my face. My face seems to be fine, and my scalp looks normal.

Do you have darker, thicker scales especially on the lower legs that become more apparent in dry climates or with age?

No, I don’t have darker, thicker scales on my lower legs. The scales I have are more fine and don’t seem to change much with the climate or as I get older.

Do you have body hair thinning or sparse eyebrows?

No, I don't have any thinning body hair, and my eyebrows look normal too. Everything seems fine in that area.

Do you have any fissuring or painful cracking on the heels or hands?

No, I don’t have any fissuring or painful cracking on my heels or hands. They just feel a bit rough and dry.

Any itch or nighttime itch?

No, I don’t have any itch at all, even at night. It just feels dry, but it doesn't bother me.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Ichthyosis vulgaris

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Fibroadenoma of the breast
doctor_hist:
When did you first notice the breast mass?

I noticed the painless mass about three weeks ago. It hasn't changed size since then.

Have you noticed any nipple discharge, skin dimpling, or changes in the nipple?

No, I haven't noticed any nipple discharge, skin dimpling, or changes in the nipple. Everything seems normal in that regard.

Have you felt any swollen lumps in your armpit or above your collarbone?

No, I haven't felt any swollen lumps in my armpit or above my collarbone. Everything feels normal in that area.

Do you have any personal or family history of breast, ovarian, or other cancers?

I don't have a personal history of any cancers, and there’s no significant family history of breast or ovarian cancer either.

Do you have regular periods, are you pregnant or breastfeeding, and how old are you?

I'm currently 17 weeks pregnant, and this is my first pregnancy. I don't breastfeed, as I haven't had the baby yet. My periods were regular before becoming pregnant.

REQUEST TEST: Breast_Ultrasound

RESULTS: - Vital Signs: - Temperature: 36.8°C (98.2°F) - Blood Pressure: 110/70 mmHg - Heart Rate: 82 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 14 breaths/min - Breast Examination: - Inspection: No skin changes or nipple discharge. - Palpation: 2.5-cm rubbery, mobile, nontender mass in the upper outer quadrant of the right breast. No axillary lymphadenopathy. - Breast Ultrasound: 2.5-cm well-circumscribed, solid mass in the right breast without suspicious features. - Biopsy: Histopathology shows rounded contour with overgrowth of fibrous and glandular tissue.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Benign reactive cervical lymphadenopathy
doctor_hist:
Can you describe your symptoms (weight change, heat/cold intolerance, palpitations, tremor, fatigue)?

I've been feeling really nervous and irritable lately, and I experience fatigue quite often. My hands and feet tend to be sweaty, and I have trouble sleeping at night, but I haven't noticed any weight changes.

Have you noticed neck pain, eye bulging, palpitations, or heat intolerance?

No, I haven't experienced any neck pain or eye bulging. I don't have palpitations or heat intolerance either. Just the sweaty palms and soles along with the other symptoms I've mentioned.

Any recent changes in bowel habits (more frequent/looser stools) or menstrual irregularities?

I haven't noticed any changes in my bowel habits, and my menstrual cycle has been regular. It's mostly just the swelling in my neck and those other symptoms.

Have you noticed tremors, anxiety with fine shaking of your hands?

I haven't noticed any tremors or fine shaking in my hands, but I do feel quite anxious at times. The nervousness seems to tie into that, but it's mostly just the swelling and fatigue that's been bothering me.

Have you had recent upper respiratory infection or sore throat preceding the neck swelling?

No, I haven't had any upper respiratory infections or sore throat before the neck swelling started. The swelling just appeared on its own about three weeks ago.

REQUEST TEST: TSH_with_reflex_free_T4_T3

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

Can you describe the neck swelling—diffuse or a single lump, tender or not, and any trouble swallowing or breathing?

The neck swelling is more like a single lump, and it's definitely not tender. I haven't had any trouble swallowing or breathing either, just the lump and the other symptoms I've mentioned.

Have you had radiation exposure, family thyroid disease, or prior thyroid nodules?

I haven't had any radiation exposure, and there’s no known family history of thyroid disease. I've never had any thyroid nodules before either.

Have you noticed the lump moving when you swallow?

No, I haven't noticed the lump moving when I swallow. It feels quite stable, just there all the time without much change.

REQUEST TEST: Thyroid_Ultrasound

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

REQUEST TEST: Thyroid_Function_Antibodies_(TPOAb,_TgAb,_TSI)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

Do you have hoarseness, voice changes, or a feeling of fullness/pressure in the neck?

No hoarseness or voice changes for me. I haven't felt any fullness or pressure in my neck either, just the lump and the other symptoms.

Have you noticed the lump enlarging, or any recent weight loss, night sweats, or fevers?

I have noticed the lump enlarging over the past few weeks, but no, I haven't experienced any weight loss, night sweats, or fevers.

Any recent travel, cat exposure, or TB contacts?

I haven’t traveled recently, and I don’t have any cats. I also haven’t had any contact with anyone who has tuberculosis.

Have you noticed the lump is hard or fixed to surrounding tissues?

The lump feels firm, but it's not fixed to the surrounding tissues. It seems to move a bit when I touch it, but it stays in the same spot overall.

Have you had any unexplained hoarseness, difficulty breathing when lying flat, or coughing when swallowing?

No unexplained hoarseness or difficulty breathing when lying flat, and I haven't coughed while swallowing either. It's mainly just the lump and the other symptoms I've described.

REQUEST TEST: Neck_CT_with_contrast

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

REQUEST TEST: Fine_Needle_Aspiration_Biopsy_of_Neck_Mass

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Viral exanthem (likely rubella)
doctor_hist:
When did the fever and rash start?

It started about three days ago. The rash and fever appeared around the same time.

Have you noticed cough, runny nose, or red eyes before or with the rash?

I had a runny nose a few days before the rash and fever started, but no cough or red eyes. The runny nose got better, though.

Any mouth sores or spots inside the cheeks?

No, I don't have any mouth sores or spots inside my cheeks. My mouth feels fine.

Have you noticed the rash starting on the face then spreading to the body, and is it itchy?

Yes, the rash started on my face and then spread to my body. It really itches a lot, and it's hard to sleep because of it.

Have you been vaccinated for measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR)?

I think I got my shots, but I'm not sure. My mom usually takes care of that.

Have you noticed any fluid-filled blisters that later scab over?

No, I haven't seen any fluid-filled blisters or anything that scabs over. Just the rash and itching.

Have you noticed swollen, tender glands behind your ears or at the back of your neck?

No, I haven't noticed any swollen or tender glands behind my ears or at the back of my neck. Everything feels normal there.

Any sore throat, headache, or joint pains?

I have a headache and my muscles hurt a bit, but my throat feels fine. No sore throat for me.

Any known exposure to someone with measles or a similar rash illness in the past 2–3 weeks?

I don't think so. I haven't been around anyone with a rash or measles that I know of. Just my friends at daycare.

Have you noticed sensitivity to light or red, watery eyes?

I haven’t noticed any sensitivity to light, and my eyes aren’t red or watery. They feel normal.

Have you had any new medications, foods, or skin products before the rash started?

I haven't used any new medications or skin products, but we did have some new snacks while camping. I had s'mores for the first time!

Any rash on the palms or soles, or involvement of the mouth, eyes, or genitals?

No rash on my palms or soles, and nothing on my mouth, eyes, or genitals. Just the rash on my body and face.

Have you noticed high fever (over 101°F/38.3°C) and did it improve as the rash appeared?

I had a fever, but I’m not sure if it was over 101°F. It hasn't really gotten better since the rash came out; I still feel pretty warm and uncomfortable.

Have you had any recent travel or contact with anyone who traveled internationally?

I went camping about a week ago, but I don't think I met anyone who traveled internationally. We just stayed in the woods with my family and some friends.

No peeling or cracking at the corners of my mouth, and my tongue looks normal. My hands and feet aren't red or swollen either. My fever has been here for about 3 days, but it hasn't lasted longer than that.

Any recent tick bites or time in tall grass/woods with insect bites during camping?

I don’t remember getting any ticks, but I do have some bug bites from camping. I was playing outside in the tall grass a lot.

Do you have a stiff neck, confusion, trouble breathing, or are you unusually sleepy?

No, I don't have a stiff neck or confusion, and I’m not having trouble breathing. I’m just feeling a bit more tired than usual because of the itching and fever.

Any small pink spots on the soft palate or back of the mouth (Forchheimer spots)?

No, I don’t see any pink spots on the soft palate or the back of my mouth. My mouth feels normal.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Extrahepatic cholestasis (suspected obstructive jaundice) despite negative imaging; consider intermittent/occult biliary obstruction such as choledocholithiasis or biliary stricture/microlithiasis
doctor_hist:
When did the yellowing start, and is it getting worse?

The yellowing started about two weeks ago, and it seems to be getting worse. My parents have noticed it more on my eyes and skin.

Any abdominal pain, especially in the right upper quadrant?

No abdominal pain has been reported. I seem to be feeling fine otherwise.

Have you noticed dark urine or pale (clay-colored) stools?

Yes, my stools have become pale recently. I haven't noticed anything unusual with my urine, though.

Have you had itching, fever, weight loss, or new medications/herbals?

I haven't had any itching or fever, and I haven't lost any weight. No new medications or herbals have been introduced either.

Any alcohol use, viral hepatitis risk (travel, tattoos, IV drugs, unprotected sex), or family history of liver/biliary disease?

I don’t have any history of alcohol use, and my family doesn’t have a history of liver or biliary disease. I haven't traveled, and my parents say there's no history of viral hepatitis.

Have you noticed yellowing of only eyes/skin, or also darkening of urine?

I've only noticed yellowing of my eyes and skin. I haven't seen any darkening in my urine.

REQUEST TEST: Comprehensive_Metabolic_Panel (including total/direct bilirubin, AST/ALT, ALP, GGT)

RESULTS: - Temperature: 36.8°C (98.2°F) - Heart Rate: 130 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 40 breaths/min - Jaundice noted on inspection - Normal bowel sounds on auscultation - Liver palpated 2 cm below the right costal margin - Bilirubin Total: 15 mg/dL - Bilirubin Direct: 12.3 mg/dL - Alkaline Phosphatase: 2007 U/L - AST: 53 U/L - ALT: 45 U/L - Gamma Glutamyl Transferase: 154 U/L - Blood Group: A positive

Have you had any recent abdominal trauma or known gallstones?

I haven't had any abdominal trauma, and my parents haven't mentioned anything about gallstones. Everything seems normal aside from the yellowing.

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

REQUEST TEST: Hepatitis_Panel (A, B, C, E serologies)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

REQUEST TEST: Coombs_Test (Direct Antiglobulin Test)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

Any recent fasting, illness, or new supplement (e.g., turmeric) before jaundice started?

I haven't had any recent fasting, illnesses, or new supplements. Everything has been pretty routine for me.

Have you noticed any abdominal swelling or visible veins on the abdomen?

I haven't noticed any abdominal swelling or visible veins on my abdomen. It looks normal to my parents.

Any pale stools continue, and any tea-colored urine now?

Yes, my stools are still pale, but I haven't noticed any tea-colored urine. It looks normal to my parents.

Have you or your parents noticed any yellowing since birth or intermittent episodes before this?

No yellowing was noticed since birth, and there haven’t been any intermittent episodes either. It just started about two weeks ago and has been getting worse.

Any recent sore throat, fever, or dark urine suggesting a recent infection like mono?

I haven’t had a sore throat or fever recently, and my urine still looks normal. No signs of infection have been noted by my parents.

REQUEST TEST: Fractionated_Bile_Acids_and_Pruritus_Assessment (serum bile acids)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Major Depressive Disorder, single episode, moderate, with trauma-related symptoms (rule out PTSD)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe how long these mood and energy changes have been going on?

It's been about two months now. I feel more tired than usual and can't seem to focus at work. It’s really affecting my day-to-day life.

Have you lost interest or pleasure in activities you usually enjoy?

Yes, I used to enjoy dance classes, but now I just don't feel like going. I’ve also lost interest in other things I used to love.

Have you noticed changes in sleep or appetite (sleeping more/less, eating more/less)?

Yes, my sleep has been really disrupted. I wake up early and can't go back to sleep. I've also noticed I've been eating less than I usually do.

Have you had feelings of worthlessness, excessive guilt, or thoughts of self-harm?

I haven't had thoughts of self-harm, but I do feel a bit worthless sometimes, especially when I think about my work performance. It’s frustrating because I want to do better.

Have you noticed your mood is mostly down nearly every day, or do you have periods of feeling unusually energetic or irritable?

Most days, I feel pretty down. I don't really have those bursts of energy or feeling irritable—I just feel tired and unmotivated all the time. It's like everything feels heavier.

Have these symptoms caused significant problems at work, home, or socially?

Yes, definitely. I’m worried about losing my job because I can’t concentrate. At home, my spouse is concerned, and socially, I’ve started isolating myself from friends and family.

Have you used alcohol, cannabis, stimulants, or new medications that might explain these changes?

I haven't been using anything new that I can think of, and I don’t really drink alcohol or use drugs. I just feel overwhelmed and exhausted.

Have you experienced slowing down or restlessness, low energy, poor concentration, or feelings of guilt nearly every day for at least two weeks?

Yes, I've been feeling low energy and can't concentrate at all. It's frustrating, and some days I feel that sense of guilt lingering over me. It's been really tough to manage.

Have you ever had a past episode like this or any diagnosed mental health condition?

I haven't had anything like this before. I’ve never been diagnosed with a mental health condition, but I’ve been feeling really off since I got back from deployment.

Have you had any traumatic experiences during deployment, such as combat exposure or events that now cause intrusive memories or avoidance?

Yes, there were some tough experiences during deployment that I haven't really talked about. Sometimes, those memories come back, and it’s hard to shake them off. I try to avoid thinking about it, but it still lingers.

Do you have nightmares, flashbacks, hypervigilance, or startle easily related to those events?

I haven't had nightmares or flashbacks like that, but sometimes I do feel on edge and more alert than usual. I try to stay aware of my surroundings, but it can be exhausting.

Have these symptoms been present most of the day, nearly every day, for at least two weeks?

Yes, they've been there most of the day, every day, for the past couple of months. It just feels like a heavy weight I can’t shake off.

Have you noticed significant psychomotor slowing or agitation (moving/speaking slower or feeling restless)?

Yes, I've noticed that I've been speaking more slowly than usual. Sometimes, I feel a bit restless, but mostly I just feel sluggish and heavy.

Have you noticed any feelings of hopelessness or trouble making decisions nearly every day?

Yes, I've definitely felt a sense of hopelessness lately. Making decisions has become really difficult, even simple ones. It just feels overwhelming.

Have you had any manic symptoms like needing little sleep with high energy, racing thoughts, impulsive spending, or feeling unusually grand?

No, I haven’t experienced any of those manic symptoms. I’ve been feeling the opposite—just really drained and unmotivated. My thoughts feel slow, not racing.

Have you had any recent weight change or significant medical issues (thyroid problems, anemia)?

I haven't noticed any significant weight change, but I do feel like I'm eating less overall. No major medical issues that I know of, just feeling really off lately.

Have you had any thoughts that life isn’t worth living or any suicidal thoughts, even fleeting?

I haven't had any thoughts of wanting to end my life, but I do feel really overwhelmed and sometimes wonder if things will ever get better. I just want to find a way to feel like myself again.

Do you have difficulty concentrating, memory problems, or feeling detached when reminded of deployment events?

Yes, I do have difficulty concentrating, and sometimes my memory feels off. When I think about deployment events, I feel a bit detached, like it's hard to connect to those memories fully. It’s unsettling.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Major Depressive Disorder, single episode, moderate, with trauma-related symptoms (rule out PTSD)

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Single small (<10 mm) tubular adenoma (low-risk adenomatous polyp) with positive FOBT; recommend surveillance colonoscopy in 7–10 years (consider 7 years given family history)
doctor_hist:
Have you noticed any changes in bowel habits, like diarrhea, constipation, or narrower stools?

No, I haven't noticed any changes in my bowel habits at all. Everything seems normal in that regard.

Any unintentional weight loss, fatigue, or abdominal pain?

No, I haven't experienced any weight loss, fatigue, or abdominal pain. I feel quite healthy otherwise.

Have you noticed visible blood in your stool or on the toilet paper?

No, I haven't seen any visible blood in my stool or on the toilet paper at all. Everything looks normal there.

REQUEST TEST: Colonoscopy

RESULTS: - Vital Signs: - Temperature: 36.8°C (98°F) - Blood Pressure: 130/85 mmHg - Heart Rate: 72 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 14 breaths/min - Abdominal Examination: - Inspection: Abdomen appears normal, no visible masses or distension. - Auscultation: Bowel sounds normal. - Percussion: Tympanic across all quadrants. - Palpation: No tenderness or palpable masses. - Rectal Examination: - Findings: No masses felt. Guaiac test positive for occult blood. - Colonoscopy Report: - Findings: A single polyp identified in the descending colon, no other abnormalities noted. Polyp was excised. - Biopsy Report: - Findings: Histopathology reveals 75% tubular architecture with no evidence of high-grade dysplasia.

Given the colonoscopy and biopsy, was the polyp reported as a tubular adenoma (low-grade dysplasia)?

Yes, that's what I understand from the report. It seems to be a tubular adenoma without any high-grade dysplasia.

Great, thanks. Any first-degree relative diagnosed with colorectal cancer before age 60?

No, my father was the only one in my immediate family, and he was diagnosed in his late 60s.

Do you have a history of inflammatory bowel disease (ulcerative colitis or Crohn’s)?

No, I don’t have a history of inflammatory bowel disease. I've generally been healthy with no such conditions.

Any use of aspirin, NSAIDs, or anticoagulants that could cause occult bleeding?

No, I haven't been taking any aspirin, NSAIDs, or anticoagulants. I usually stick to over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen when needed.

Any iron-deficiency anemia or low ferritin on recent labs?

No, I haven't been informed of any iron-deficiency anemia or low ferritin levels from my recent labs. Everything seemed normal in those regards.

Have you had any previous colon polyps or colorectal cancer screenings before this one?

No, I don't have any personal history of hereditary syndromes like FAP or Lynch. I haven't been diagnosed with anything like that before.

No, there isn't any family history of multiple polyps, and I haven't had any genetic testing for colorectal cancer syndromes. Just my father's history with large intestinal cancer.

No, I don't smoke at all, and my alcohol consumption is very moderate, just socially. I don't consider it heavy by any means.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Benign premature thelarche with probable toddler’s fracture/occult injury causing left femoral pain and limp; vaginal spotting likely self-limited nonhormonal/traumatic etiology
doctor_hist:
Can you tell me the child’s age and when the vaginal bleeding started?

I'm 18 months old, and my mom noticed the brown discharge with clots a little while ago, but I don’t know exactly when.

Any breast development, pubic/underarm hair, or body odor noticed?

I have noticeable swelling in my breasts, but I don't have any pubic hair or underarm hair. No strong body odor either.

Any recent head trauma, headaches, vision changes, or seizures?

I haven’t had any head trauma, and I don’t have headaches or vision changes. I’ve never had seizures either.

Any café-au-lait spots on skin, early growth spurt, or bone deformities like bowing?

I have some brown patches on my skin that are about 2-3 cm, but I don’t think I’ve had any growth spurts or bone deformities. My legs look normal to me.

Any bone pain location, limp side, or fractures so far?

My left leg hurts, and I’ve been limping on that side since I fell two months ago. I don't think I've had any fractures, though.

Does the leg pain worsen at night or with activity, and is there any swelling or tenderness over the left thigh or hip?

My leg pain gets a bit worse at night, and I've noticed some tenderness over my left thigh, but I can't really tell if there's any swelling.

REQUEST TEST: Left_Femur_X-Ray

RESULTS: Patchy areas of lytic bone and sclerosis within the femoral metaphysis.

Any vaginal trauma, foreign body insertion, or signs of infection (odor, itching)?

I haven’t had any vaginal trauma or foreign objects, and my mom hasn’t noticed any unusual odor or itching.

Any episodes of vaginal bleeding recurring, and how long did the breast swelling last?

I don't know if the vaginal bleeding has happened again since it was first noticed. The breast swelling has been there for a little while, but I’m not sure exactly how long.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Exertional tibial nerve entrapment (likely dynamic tarsal tunnel syndrome) exacerbated by plantarflexion/inversion and tight footwear, without resting neuropathy or peripheral arterial disease
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the exact location of the tingling—heel, arch, toes, or along the inside of the ankle?

It's mostly in the arch of my right foot, but sometimes I feel it radiating towards the toes.

Does the tingling worsen at night or when lying down, and does dangling the foot off the bed relieve it?

No, the tingling doesn't worsen at night, and dangling my foot off the bed doesn’t seem to help much. It’s mainly an issue during the day, especially when I exercise.

Do you notice numbness or burning plus weakness of toe flexion, and any shooting pain with tapping behind the inner ankle (Tinel’s sign at the tarsal tunnel)?

I don't notice any numbness or burning, but there is some weakness when I try to flex my toes. Tapping behind my inner ankle doesn't cause any shooting pain either.

Do you have heel pain with first steps in the morning or after rest that eases as you walk?

No, I don't have any heel pain in the morning or after resting. The discomfort is mostly in the arch and sole of my right foot when I elevate it.

Any calf cramping with walking that improves with rest (claudication)?

Yes, I do experience cramping in my right calf when I walk, especially when using the incline on the treadmill. It gets better after I take a break and rest for a few minutes.

REQUEST TEST: Ankle_Brachial_Index (ABI)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do your symptoms improve when you stop exercising and rest, and do you ever get back pain radiating down the leg?

Yes, my symptoms do improve when I stop exercising and rest for a few minutes. I don't experience any back pain radiating down my leg, though.

Have you noticed color changes, coolness, or delayed capillary refill in the right foot during or after exercise?

I haven't noticed any color changes or coolness in my right foot during or after exercise. The capillary refill seems normal as well; it returns to normal quick.

Do you have back-of-knee or inner-ankle swelling/tenderness, and does pressing along the tibial nerve behind the medial malleolus reproduce the tingling?

I don't have any swelling or tenderness behind my knee or inner ankle. Pressing along the tibial nerve doesn’t reproduce the tingling either; it's mostly localized to the arch of my foot.

Do tight shoes or recent increase in running/incline aggravate it, and does arch support or rest help?

Yes, tight shoes do aggravate the tingling, especially when I’m exercising. I haven't tried arch support yet, but resting definitely helps alleviate the discomfort.

Have you had any back-of-leg tightness or tenderness in the calf or along the plantar fascia when you press it?

No, I haven't felt any tightness or tenderness in the back of my leg or along the plantar fascia when I press it. It's mainly just the tingling and cramping in my foot and calf during exercise.

Have you noticed numbness or tingling between the third and fourth toes, and does squeezing the forefoot worsen it?

No, I haven't noticed any numbness or tingling between my third and fourth toes, and squeezing the forefoot doesn't seem to worsen the discomfort. The tingling is more focused on the arch of my right foot.

Have you had low back issues or prior injuries to the foot/ankle?

I haven't had any low back issues or injuries to my foot or ankle in the past. Everything seemed fine until these recent symptoms started.

Have you noticed the pulses on the top of your right foot or behind the ankle feeling weaker than the left during or after exercise?

I haven't noticed any difference in the pulses on the top of my right foot or behind the ankle compared to the left. They seem to feel normal during and after exercise.

Any numbness or tingling in both feet symmetrically (stocking-glove pattern), or only the right?

No, the tingling is only in my right foot, not in both feet. I haven't experienced any numbness or tingling in a stocking-glove pattern.

Have you noticed foot arch collapse or flatfoot on the right, and does standing on tiptoes reduce the tingling?

I haven't noticed any collapse of the foot arch or flatfoot on the right. Standing on tiptoes doesn’t seem to reduce the tingling either; it feels pretty much the same.

Do you feel the tingling worsen when you point your toes down or invert the foot (plantarflex/invert), or improve when you rest the foot in neutral?

When I point my toes down or invert my foot, the tingling does seem to worsen. Resting the foot in a neutral position helps, but it doesn’t completely eliminate the discomfort.

Given your symptoms, I suspect tibial nerve irritation or compression around the ankle (tarsal tunnel area) despite a negative Tinel’s; the worsening with plantarflexion/inversion and relief in neutral support this. Do you have tingling or weakness reproduced by prolonged standing or after long walks on hard surfaces?

I haven't noticed any tingling or weakness from prolonged standing or long walks on hard surfaces. The symptoms seem to be mainly related to exercise and elevation of my foot.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Exertional tibial nerve entrapment (likely dynamic tarsal tunnel syndrome) exacerbated by plantarflexion/inversion and tight footwear, without resting neuropathy or peripheral arterial disease

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Intradermal nevus (pink dome-shaped benign nevus)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe the lesion’s appearance (color, shape, surface) and how long it’s been there?

It's a pink bump, kind of rounded, and it feels a bit rough on the surface. It started developing about a month ago.

Any pain, bleeding, or rapid growth?

No pain or bleeding, but it has definitely grown quickly over the past month.

Any history of excessive sun exposure or tanning, and do you use sunscreen regularly?

Yes, I’ve had a lot of sun exposure throughout my life, including several blistering sunburns. I don't use sunscreen regularly, though.

Any crusting, central indentation, or a horn-like projection on top?

No crusting or central indentation, but it does feel a bit rough like there's a tiny bump on top.

Any visible blood vessels on it, and does it feel fixed to the skin or mobile?

I haven't noticed any visible blood vessels on it. It feels like it's mobile, not fixed to the skin.

Any scaling or sandpaper-like texture, and does it become tender when you press on it?

No scaling or sandpaper-like texture that I can tell, and it doesn't become tender when I press on it.

Any ulceration, rolled borders, or pearly/translucent appearance?

No ulceration or rolled borders, and the bump doesn’t have a pearly or translucent appearance. It's just a solid pink bump on my forehead.

Any central keratin plug or horn-like tip developing?

No, I haven’t noticed any central keratin plug or horn-like tip developing on the bump. It just remains a smooth, rough pink bump.

Any change in color (brown/black) or irregular pigmentation within the bump?

I haven't noticed any changes in color; it remains a solid pink without any brown or black spots. The pigmentation seems consistent.

Any itch, and what are its approximate size and border definition (well-defined vs blurred)?

I haven't experienced any itching. The bump is about the size of a small marble, and the borders are fairly well-defined, not blurred at all.

Do you have a history of skin cancer or precancer (actinic keratoses, BCC, SCC), or immune suppression?

I don't have a history of skin cancer or precancerous lesions. I've never been diagnosed with actinic keratoses, BCC, or SCC, and I’m not immune suppressed.

Do you notice a central dimple when you pinch the sides of the bump (dimple sign)?

I haven't noticed any central dimple when I pinch the sides; it looks pretty consistent all around.

Any recent insect bite, trauma, or new cosmetic/skin product applied to the area?

No, I haven't had any recent insect bites or trauma to the area. I also haven't used any new cosmetic or skin products on my forehead.

Any personal or family history of atypical moles or melanoma?

I don’t have any personal history of atypical moles or melanoma, and there’s no known family history of it either.

Any hair growing from the bump, and is the surface dome-shaped and firm?

No hair is growing from the bump, and it does have a dome-shaped appearance. It feels firm to the touch.

Is there a central pore or plug if you look closely?

I don't see any central pore or plug when I look closely at the bump. It just seems to be smooth without any openings.

Any peripheral telangiectasias or shiny surface under bright light?

I haven't noticed any peripheral telangiectasias, and the surface doesn't appear shiny under bright light. It looks pretty consistent with what I've described.

REQUEST TEST: Dermoscopy_of_lesion

RESULTS: Normal readings.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Intradermal nevus (pink dome-shaped benign nevus)
patient_hist:
Can you describe the lesion’s appearance (color, shape, surface) and how long it’s been there?

It's a pink bump, kind of rounded, and it feels a bit rough on the surface. It started developing about a month ago.

Any pain, bleeding, or rapid growth?

No pain or bleeding, but it has definitely grown quickly over the past month.

Any history of excessive sun exposure or tanning, and do you use sunscreen regularly?

Yes, I’ve had a lot of sun exposure throughout my life, including several blistering sunburns. I don't use sunscreen regularly, though.

Any crusting, central indentation, or a horn-like projection on top?

No crusting or central indentation, but it does feel a bit rough like there's a tiny bump on top.

Any visible blood vessels on it, and does it feel fixed to the skin or mobile?

I haven't noticed any visible blood vessels on it. It feels like it's mobile, not fixed to the skin.

Any scaling or sandpaper-like texture, and does it become tender when you press on it?

No scaling or sandpaper-like texture that I can tell, and it doesn't become tender when I press on it.

Any ulceration, rolled borders, or pearly/translucent appearance?

No ulceration or rolled borders, and the bump doesn’t have a pearly or translucent appearance. It's just a solid pink bump on my forehead.

Any central keratin plug or horn-like tip developing?

No, I haven’t noticed any central keratin plug or horn-like tip developing on the bump. It just remains a smooth, rough pink bump.

Any change in color (brown/black) or irregular pigmentation within the bump?

I haven't noticed any changes in color; it remains a solid pink without any brown or black spots. The pigmentation seems consistent.

Any itch, and what are its approximate size and border definition (well-defined vs blurred)?

I haven't experienced any itching. The bump is about the size of a small marble, and the borders are fairly well-defined, not blurred at all.

Do you have a history of skin cancer or precancer (actinic keratoses, BCC, SCC), or immune suppression?

I don't have a history of skin cancer or precancerous lesions. I've never been diagnosed with actinic keratoses, BCC, or SCC, and I’m not immune suppressed.

Do you notice a central dimple when you pinch the sides of the bump (dimple sign)?

I haven't noticed any central dimple when I pinch the sides; it looks pretty consistent all around.

Any recent insect bite, trauma, or new cosmetic/skin product applied to the area?

No, I haven't had any recent insect bites or trauma to the area. I also haven't used any new cosmetic or skin products on my forehead.

Any personal or family history of atypical moles or melanoma?

I don’t have any personal history of atypical moles or melanoma, and there’s no known family history of it either.

Any hair growing from the bump, and is the surface dome-shaped and firm?

No hair is growing from the bump, and it does have a dome-shaped appearance. It feels firm to the touch.

Is there a central pore or plug if you look closely?

I don't see any central pore or plug when I look closely at the bump. It just seems to be smooth without any openings.

Any peripheral telangiectasias or shiny surface under bright light?

I haven't noticed any peripheral telangiectasias, and the surface doesn't appear shiny under bright light. It looks pretty consistent with what I've described.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Ingrown toenail (onychocryptosis) of the left big toe
doctor_hist:
Can you describe what you notice about the baby’s left foot or toes (swelling, color change, redness, wounds)?

I can't really see my toes, but my foot feels a bit uncomfortable. It just hurts a lot!

Can you check the left toes closely: do you see a hair or thread wrapped around any toe, or a deep groove/indent?

I can’t see any hair or thread, but I can feel something tight around my toe. It really hurts!

Can you look again at the most painful toe: is it swollen, red/purple, or cooler than the others?

I can’t really see it too well, but it feels pretty swollen and a bit warm. It still really hurts, especially when I wiggle my toes.

Can you gently separate the toe folds and look with a bright light/magnifier: do you see any tight line or groove encircling the base of the painful toe?

I can't really see down there, but it feels like something is really pressing into my skin. It’s very uncomfortable when I try to move it.

REQUEST TEST: Bedside_Exam_Left_Toes_with_Magnification_and_Gentle_Separation_of_Folds

RESULTS: Normal readings.

Do you notice any ingrown toenail, redness at the nail edge, or pus from the most painful toe?

I can't really see my toe, but it feels kind of sensitive around the nail area. There's a little bit of discomfort, not much else.

Does the pain worsen when the sock is on or after wearing footed pajamas, and does removing them give brief relief?

It seems to hurt more when I wear socks, and taking them off does feel a little better for a moment.

Does loosening or removing any toe band or elastic on the sock immediately reduce the pain?

Oh yes, when the sock is loose or off, it feels a bit better for a while. But as soon as it gets tight again, the pain comes back.

Does the toe pain improve if you gently massage the base of the toe and check under any toe creases?

It feels a bit better when you gently press around there, but it still hurts quite a lot. I don’t like it when you touch the very tip of my toe, though.

REQUEST TEST: Remove_Sock_and_Inspect_Left_Toes_for_Hair_or_Thread_with_Full_Circumferential_Check_Using_Loupe_and_Moistening_Crevices

RESULTS: Normal readings.

REQUEST TEST: Capillary_Refill_and_Temperature_Comparison_All_Toes_Left_vs_Right

RESULTS: Normal readings.

REQUEST TEST: Palpate_and_Inspect_Left_First_Metatarsophalangeal_and_Interphalangeal_Joints_for_Tenderness_Swelling_Range_of_Motion_and_Crepitus

RESULTS: Normal readings.

REQUEST TEST: Inspect_Left_Toe_Webspaces_and_Nail_Folds_for_Retained_Hair_Thread_or_Fiber_After_Warm_Soak_and_Gentle_Spreading_with_Cotton_Tip

RESULTS: Normal readings.

REQUEST TEST: Transillumination_and_Dermatoscope_Exam_of_Left_Toes_for_Subcutaneous_Hair_Tourniquet_or_Fiber_Embedded_in_Sulcus_after_Liberal_Lubrication

RESULTS: Normal readings.

Do you notice any small blister, peeling skin, or rash between the toes or on the tip?

I can’t see too well between my toes, but it feels a bit itchy there. There's no blister or rash that I can feel, just some discomfort.

Do the nails or skin around the left big toe look curved into the skin or tender when pressed at the nail edge?

I can't really see my nails, but it feels sensitive around the big toe. It hurts a bit when you touch the edge of the nail.

Does the big toe’s lateral nail edge feel more tender than the center of the nail?

It feels a bit more tender on the side of the big toe than in the center. It's really sensitive when you touch it there.

Does the skin at the big toe’s side look puffy with a small rim of redness where the nail edge meets the skin?

I can't really see the skin there, but it feels pretty puffy and tender. It hurts a lot when you touch the side.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Takotsubo (stress-induced) cardiomyopathy
doctor_hist:
Where exactly is your chest pain, and does it spread to your arm, jaw, or back?

It's mostly in the middle of my chest, and it doesn't really spread anywhere else. It feels really tight and sharp.

How long has the pain lasted, and what were you doing when it started?

It started about an hour ago while I was sitting quietly at home. It just came on suddenly and has been consistent since then.

Do you have shortness of breath, sweating, nausea, or lightheadedness?

I do feel a bit short of breath, and I’ve had some sweating. No nausea or lightheadedness, though.

Do you have any risk factors—high blood pressure, diabetes, high cholesterol, smoking, or family history of heart disease?

I don’t have any of those risk factors, and I’ve never had any major health issues before. My family history is also pretty clear.

Have you noticed any chest tenderness when pressing on the area or pain that worsens with deep breaths or movement?

I haven't noticed any tenderness when I press on my chest, but taking deep breaths does make the pain feel worse. Moving around also increases the discomfort a little.

Does the pain change with body position (better leaning forward, worse lying flat)?

I haven’t really tried changing positions, but I feel like leaning forward might help a little. Lying back doesn’t feel comfortable at all.

REQUEST TEST: ECG

RESULTS: ECG findings show no significant findings.

Any recent viral illness, sore throat, or fever before the pain began?

I haven't had any recent viral illness, sore throat, or fever. It all started after my husband passed away; it’s been really overwhelming.

REQUEST TEST: Troponin_I_and_T (serial)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Have you had any recent long trips, leg swelling, or calf pain?

I haven't had any long trips recently, and I don't have any swelling or pain in my legs. I've mostly been at home dealing with everything.

Any cough, fever, or recent respiratory infection?

I haven't had any cough, fever, or respiratory infection recently. It's really just been this chest pain and the emotional turmoil from losing my husband.

Have you had recent trauma or heavy lifting, or is the pain reproducible with pressing on the chest now?

I haven’t had any recent trauma or heavy lifting, and pressing on my chest still doesn’t cause any pain. It’s just that tight, sharp feeling that’s really distressing.

Does the pain improve when you sit leaning forward and worsen when lying flat?

It does seem to feel a little better when I lean forward, but lying flat is definitely uncomfortable and makes the pain worse.

Any recent vaccinations or autoimmune conditions?

I haven’t had any recent vaccinations, and I don’t have any autoimmune conditions that I know of. It's really mostly been this overwhelming stress.

Any fever or pleuritic chest pain with a pericardial friction rub on exam?

I haven't had any fever, and I don't feel any pleuritic chest pain. I also haven’t noticed a friction rub during the exam.

Do you have chest pain when swallowing or recent heartburn/acid reflux?

I haven't had any chest pain when swallowing, and I don't usually deal with heartburn or acid reflux. The pain feels more sharp and tight rather than burning.

Any recent intense emotional stress just before the pain started, and are you postmenopausal?

Yes, I've been under a lot of emotional stress since my husband passed away just recently. I'm not postmenopausal; I'm still having regular menstrual cycles.

REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram

RESULTS: Echocardiography findings show enlarged left ventricle and left atrium.

REQUEST TEST: Coronary_Angiography

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGSThis is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Alcohol-induced atrial fibrillation (“holiday heart syndrome”)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe when the dizziness and palpitations started and what you were doing at the time?

I first noticed the dizziness and palpitations two days ago. I was at a bachelor party when it began, right after drinking quite a bit.

How much alcohol did you drink, and have you used caffeine, energy drinks, or other substances?

I probably had around five or six drinks over the course of the night. I don't usually drink that much, and I haven’t had any caffeine or energy drinks recently.

Have the dizziness and palpitations continued since then, and are they constant or in episodes?

Yes, the dizziness and palpitations have continued since then. They seem to come and go in episodes, especially when I try to be more active.

Have you had chest pain, shortness of breath, fainting, or near-fainting during these episodes?

No chest pain or fainting, but I do experience shortness of breath when I try to exert myself. It feels exhausting.

Have you noticed an irregular or rapid heartbeat when you check your pulse during episodes?

I've noticed that my heartbeat feels a bit rapid and sometimes irregular when I check my pulse during those episodes. It can be unsettling.

REQUEST TEST: ECG_12-lead

RESULTS: Irregularly irregular rhythm, absent P waves, and variable R-R intervals consistent with atrial fibrillation.

Given the onset after binge drinking and ECG findings, this looks like “holiday heart.” Any history of high blood pressure, thyroid disease, or prior heart issues?

I don't have any history of high blood pressure, thyroid disease, or any previous heart issues. I've always been relatively healthy.

Any chest discomfort, leg swelling, or recent long travel or immobilization?

No, I haven’t experienced any chest discomfort or leg swelling, and I haven’t traveled or been immobilized recently. Everything feels pretty normal aside from the dizziness and palpitations.

REQUEST TEST: TSH_with_reflex_free_T4

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: BMP_electrolytes (Na/K/Mg/Ca)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Any ongoing alcohol use since the episode, or have symptoms improved with abstinence?

I haven’t had any alcohol since the bachelor party. The symptoms have improved a bit since I stopped drinking, but I still feel occasional dizziness and palpitations.

Have you had any fever, recent infection, or stimulant/decongestant medication use?

No, I haven't had a fever or any recent infections, and I haven't taken any stimulant or decongestant medications either. I'm just trying to rest and stay hydrated.

Have you ever had similar symptoms after past episodes of heavier drinking?

No, I haven't experienced similar symptoms after past instances of heavier drinking. This is the first time I've felt this way.

Any lightheadedness when standing up quickly, or does it occur even at rest?

I do feel a bit lightheaded when I stand up quickly, but it can also happen when I'm sitting or lying down. It seems to come and go, regardless of my position.

Have you had any recent cold symptoms, chest infection, or heavy snoring suggestive of sleep apnea?

No, I haven't had any recent cold symptoms, chest infections, or any issues with heavy snoring. My sleep has been pretty normal.

Any history of recent heavy alcohol use before this episode besides the party, or family history of arrhythmias?

I haven't had any heavy alcohol use before this episode, and there's no known family history of arrhythmias. My family has generally been healthy.

Any bleeding, black stools, or weight loss?

No, I haven’t noticed any bleeding, black stools, or weight loss. My appetite has been normal, and I'm eating well.

Any recent COVID-19 infection or vaccination in the last month?

I haven’t had a COVID-19 infection or vaccination in the last month. I've been feeling fine aside from the dizziness and palpitations.This is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

Yes, the dizziness and palpitations have continued since then. They seem to come and go in episodes, especially when I try to be more active.

No chest pain or fainting, but I do experience shortness of breath when I try to exert myself. It feels exhausting.

I've noticed that my heartbeat feels a bit rapid and sometimes irregular when I check my pulse during those episodes. It can be unsettling.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Traumatic left-sided mainstem bronchial obstruction from mediastinal hematoma causing extrinsic airway compression (post–high-speed MVC)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe your breathing—sudden shortness of breath, chest pain, or cough since the crash?

I’m having a lot of trouble breathing, and it feels very tight. I can’t seem to catch my breath, and I haven't coughed much.

Do you have chest pain that worsens with deep breaths or movement?

It feels pretty tight in my chest, especially when I move, but I can't really tell if it's actual pain. I just feel really uncomfortable.

REQUEST TEST: Chest_X-Ray

RESULTS: Fractured left second rib, depression of the left mainstem bronchus, deviation of the nasogastric tube to the right, and a widened mediastinum.

REQUEST TEST: CT_Chest_with_Contrast (aortogram)

NORMAL READINGS

Do you have hoarseness, difficulty swallowing, or new bruising/swelling at the base of your neck?

I don’t have trouble swallowing, but I do notice some swelling around my neck and it feels a bit bruised.

Do you have noisy breathing (stridor) or voice changes?

I haven't noticed any stridor or voice changes, but it feels like my throat is constricted. It's hard to tell what's normal right now.

Do you feel chest crepitus or notice swelling/crackling under the skin when you press your neck or chest?

I can feel some swelling when I touch my neck, but I haven't noticed any crackling or crepitus under the skin. It just feels really tender and tight.

Do you have sudden facial or arm swelling or visible chest wall vein distention (suggesting venous congestion)?

I don't have any sudden swelling in my arms or face, but my facial lacerations are really bothering me. I can't see any chest wall veins standing out, though.

Any history of high-speed impact, seatbelt sign, or airbag deployment?

Yes, I was in a high-speed collision as a passenger, and I was wearing my seatbelt. The impact was really intense, and I felt jostled around a lot.

Any new shortness of breath when lying flat or improvement when sitting up?

I feel short of breath when I lie flat, and sitting up does help a bit, but I still can’t get comfortable.

Do you have one-sided diminished breath sounds or tracheal deviation on exam?

I can’t really tell about the tracheal deviation, but I think my left side feels different. The doctor mentioned something about diminished breath sounds there during the exam.

REQUEST TEST: Bronchoscopy

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do you have chest pain or shortness of breath that worsens with deep inhalation or coughing, suggesting pleuritic pain?

It’s hard to tell if it’s pleuritic pain, but any time I take a deep breath, it feels really tight and uncomfortable. I haven’t had much coughing though.

Do you have swelling or tenderness just above your collarbones with crackling when pressing there?

I can feel some tenderness above my collarbone, but I haven't noticed any crackling when I press there. It just feels sore and sensitive.

Do you have sudden chest tightness with hypotension or muffled heart sounds?

I haven’t noticed any sudden chest tightness, and I feel a bit weak, but I’m not sure about my blood pressure. My heart doesn't feel muffled to me, just racing a lot.

Do you have swelling or visible veins on your chest/neck with shortness of breath that worsens when raising your arms (arm elevation test)?

I don't see any visible veins on my chest or neck, but it definitely feels harder to breathe when I raise my arms. It just adds to the tightness in my chest.

Do you have sudden left chest pain with rapid breathing and low oxygen that improves with high-flow oxygen?

I’ve been struggling to breathe and feel really short of breath, but I haven’t noticed any specific chest pain on my left side. I do feel a bit better when I receive oxygen, though.

Do you have neck or chest swelling that crackles with touch and worsens when you exhale or speak?

I can feel some swelling in my neck and it hurts a bit when I talk, but I haven't noticed any crackling when I touch it. Exhaling also makes everything feel tighter.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
doctor_hist:
Can you describe your main symptoms since returning from active duty (e.g., nightmares, flashbacks, anxiety, low mood)?

I've been experiencing really upsetting dreams and intense flashbacks. It feels like I'm constantly anxious and on edge. Loud noises make me feel scared, and I've been avoiding places that remind me of my time in Iraq.

Have these symptoms lasted more than one month, and are they interfering with your work, relationships, or sleep?

Yes, they've been going on for about seven weeks now. It's definitely affecting my ability to work and causing tension in my relationships. Sleep has been really difficult because of the dreams and feeling on edge.

Have you had any thoughts of harming yourself or others?

I haven't thought about harming myself or others, but I do feel overwhelmed and trapped sometimes. It's just really hard to cope with everything.

Have you noticed feeling detached, numb, or losing interest in activities you used to enjoy?

I do feel a bit detached at times, like I'm not really present. Activities I used to enjoy just don’t seem as meaningful anymore, and I find it hard to motivate myself to do them. It’s like a fog has settled in.

Have you experienced intrusive memories, nightmares, or flashbacks triggered by reminders despite trying to avoid them?

Yes, I have intrusive memories and flashbacks that just show up, especially when I hear loud noises or see anything related to my time in Iraq. I try to avoid those reminders, but they still creep in and take me back to those moments. It’s really distressing.

Have you had symptoms like hypervigilance, exaggerated startle, trouble concentrating, or irritability most days?

Yes, I feel like I'm always on high alert, and I get startled really easily. It's hard to concentrate on anything, and I find myself getting irritable over small things.

Have you used alcohol or substances to cope, or had any recent head injuries?

I haven’t used alcohol or substances to cope, but I did bump my head a few weeks ago during some training. I didn't think much of it at the time.

Have you had headaches, dizziness, nausea, confusion, or memory problems since that head bump?

I haven't really had any headaches, dizziness, or nausea since the bump. I feel a bit foggy at times, though, like my memory isn’t as sharp as it used to be. It's more the stress and anxiety that's been overwhelming.

Have you noticed depressed mood most days, changes in appetite, or feelings of guilt or worthlessness?

I’ve definitely been feeling down most days, and I often experience guilt about things that happened during my deployment. My appetite has changed a bit, but it’s mostly the guilt and sadness that weigh on me.

Have you had any panic attacks or dissociative episodes where you feel detached from reality?

I haven't had full-blown panic attacks, but there are times when I feel really detached from everything, like I'm watching it all from a distance. It’s unsettling, and I just want to escape those moments.

Have these symptoms started within 6 months of the traumatic events, and did they begin soon after returning from deployment?

Yes, these symptoms started about three months after I returned from deployment, so it's definitely within that timeframe. It all began around seven weeks ago when things started to get overwhelming for me.

Have you noticed persistent negative beliefs about yourself or the world, or excessive blame related to the trauma?

I've been struggling with negative thoughts about myself, feeling like I didn't do enough during my time in Iraq. I keep thinking that I'm a burden to those around me, and it's hard to shake that feeling. It makes everything feel heavier.

Have you had any current or past suicidal thoughts, plans, or self-harm behaviors, even fleeting?

I haven't had any suicidal thoughts or plans, but there are moments when I feel really overwhelmed and just wish I could escape everything. It's more about feeling trapped than wanting to harm myself.

Have you ever been diagnosed with PTSD, depression, or anxiety before this deployment?

I’ve never been diagnosed with PTSD, depression, or anxiety before this deployment. I’ve always been able to handle stress pretty well, but this feels different, like I can’t shake it off.

Have you been avoiding thoughts, feelings, or conversations about the trauma, and avoiding activities or people that remind you of it?

Yes, I've been trying really hard to avoid thinking or talking about my experiences in Iraq. I also find myself avoiding friends and activities that remind me of that time, just to keep myself from feeling overwhelmed. It’s like I’m isolating myself to feel safer.

Have you noticed problems with sleep duration or quality beyond nightmares, like difficulty falling or staying asleep?

I've been having a lot of trouble falling asleep and staying asleep. Even when I do manage to sleep, it doesn’t feel restful because I keep waking up from those upsetting dreams. I just feel exhausted all the time.

Have you had any medical conditions, medications, or thyroid issues that could affect mood or sleep?

I haven't had any medical conditions or thyroid issues before. I’m not on any medications either; this is all pretty new for me.

Have you noticed that these symptoms cause significant distress or impairment in daily functioning across work, social life, or self-care?

Absolutely, these symptoms have taken a toll on my daily life. I struggle to focus at work, and it’s hard to maintain relationships with friends and family. Self-care feels like a challenge when I’m feeling overwhelmed all the time.

REQUEST TEST: PHQ-9 Questionnaire

RESULTS: NON-applicable for this case.This is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Gitelman syndrome
doctor_hist:
When did these symptoms start, and have they been getting worse?

The symptoms started a few months ago, and they seem to be getting worse, especially the weakness and thirst.

Have you noticed weight loss, nausea, or vomiting?

No, I haven't noticed any weight loss, and I don't feel nauseous or have any vomiting.

Have you been waking up at night to urinate or drink water?

Yes, I've been waking up at night to go to the bathroom and sometimes to drink water too.

Have you had headaches, vision changes, or episodes of fainting?

No, I haven't had any headaches, my vision seems fine, and I haven't fainted at all.

Have you had bedwetting, daytime accidents, or very dilute, almost colorless urine?

I haven't had any bedwetting or daytime accidents, but I do notice my urine is quite light in color.

Have you had salt cravings with dizziness on standing, darkening of skin, or tummy pain?

I do have cravings for salty foods, but I haven't experienced dizziness when I stand up, and my tummy doesn't hurt.

Have you been more tired after activities with muscle cramps or weakness improving after salty snacks?

I do feel more tired after playing, and sometimes I get muscle cramps. Eating something salty seems to help me feel a bit better afterward.

I haven't been taking any medications or supplements. Just the usual vitamins my mom gives me.

I don't think so. My parents haven't mentioned any issues like that, and I don't know of any family members with similar problems.

No, I haven't noticed any excessive sweating or heat intolerance, and my sweat doesn't taste very salty either.

No, I haven't had any episodes of muscle weakness during car rides or after resting. I just feel weak overall, especially when I play.

No, I don't crave ice or chew on it. I just really like salty snacks.

No, I haven't had any vomiting or diarrhea, and I don't experience episodes of tetany. I do have frequent constipation, though.

I do have cravings for salty foods, but I haven't experienced dizziness when I stand up, and my tummy doesn't hurt.

Have you been more tired after activities with muscle cramps or weakness improving after salty snacks?

I do feel more tired after playing, and sometimes I get muscle cramps. Eating something salty seems to help me feel a bit better afterward.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Schizoid Personality Disorder
doctor_hist:
Can you tell me when the social withdrawal began and how long it’s been ongoing?

It started about two years ago, and it’s been getting worse since then. I just feel more comfortable being alone.

Have you lost interest or pleasure in activities you used to enjoy?

Yeah, I used to like hanging out with friends and going to events, but now I just prefer to stay in and read. It feels like those things don’t matter to me anymore.

Have you felt persistently sad, hopeless, or had low energy most days over these two years?

I wouldn’t say I feel sad or hopeless, but I guess I often just feel... indifferent. It’s more like I don’t care to engage, rather than feeling down.

Do you have unusual beliefs, hear or see things others don’t, or feel people are watching you?

No, I don't have any unusual beliefs or experiences like that. I just feel more comfortable in my own space, away from others.

Do you find close relationships emotionally taxing or prefer not to have them at all, including with family?

I definitely prefer not to have close relationships. Even with my family, I feel like it’s easier to just keep my distance. It's less overwhelming that way.

Do you experience strong anxiety or fear in social situations, or is it more a lack of desire for social contact?

I wouldn’t say I feel anxious. It’s more like I just don’t have the desire to be around people. I find it easier to be by myself.

Do you have a limited range of emotions and rarely feel strong joy, anger, or warmth toward others?

I wouldn’t say I have a limited range of emotions, but I definitely don’t feel strong connections or warmth towards others. It’s more like I don’t really feel the need for those emotions in my life.

Do you function well in work or school and daily self-care despite preferring solitude?

I think I manage okay at school and take care of myself, but I just do the bare minimum. I keep up with my studies, but I don’t really engage with others.

Do you have a history of trauma, bullying, or autism spectrum traits (e.g., lifelong social difficulties, restricted interests)?

I haven’t experienced any trauma or bullying, and I wouldn’t say I’ve had lifelong social difficulties. I just feel comfortable being on my own and don’t see a need for more social interaction.

Do you feel indifferent to praise or criticism and prefer solitary activities over group ones most of the time?

Yeah, I don't really feel much about praise or criticism. I usually choose solitary activities, like reading, over anything in a group. It just feels easier that way.

Do you have few or no close friends and feel detached even from first-degree relatives?

I have no close friends and I do feel pretty detached from my family. It just seems simpler to keep things that way.

Have these patterns started before age 25 and remained stable over time?

I think these patterns started well before I turned 16, but they've definitely become more pronounced over the last two years. It feels like my preferences have remained the same throughout.

Have these traits caused clinically significant distress or impairment, or are you largely content with this lifestyle?

I wouldn't say it's caused me distress. I'm mostly content just doing my own thing and being alone. It’s just the way I prefer to live these days.

Have you ever had periods of elevated mood, decreased need for sleep, or impulsive behavior lasting days?

No, I haven’t had any periods like that. My mood has been pretty steady, and I don’t generally feel the need to do anything impulsive. I just stick to my routine.

Have others reported you seem emotionally cold or aloof, and do you rarely desire or enjoy sexual experiences?

I suppose some people have mentioned that I seem distant or cold, but I don't really notice it myself. As for sexual experiences, I don’t have any desire for them; it just doesn’t interest me.

Do you use substances (alcohol, cannabis, other drugs) that affect your social interest?

I don’t use any substances at all. I’ve never felt the need for them; I just prefer to keep to myself.

Do you have a history of conduct problems, odd behaviors, or cognitive difficulties that affect daily functioning?

No, I don’t have any history of conduct problems or odd behaviors. I function pretty normally in daily life; it’s just that I prefer to do things on my own.

Do you feel little pleasure from most activities overall, or is it mainly social contact you don’t desire?

I mainly lack desire for social contact. I still find some enjoyment in activities like reading, but overall, I just prefer my own company.

Do you want help changing this, or are you satisfied living this way?

I don’t really feel the need for change. I’m comfortable with how things are, and I prefer to keep it that way for now.This is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.

diagnosis_text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Adhesive capsulitis (frozen shoulder)
doctor_hist:
When did the arm stiffness start, and is it constant or worse at certain times of day?

It started a few months ago and it's pretty much constant, but it feels worse in the mornings when I wake up.

Does the stiffness improve after 30–60 minutes of movement in the morning?

Yes, it does seem to get a bit better after I move around for a while in the morning. But it still lingers throughout the day.

Any shoulder pain with reaching overhead or behind your back?

No, I don't have any pain when reaching overhead or behind my back, just the stiffness and limited movement.

Any joint swelling, redness, warmth, or recent injury to the arm?

No, I don’t have any swelling, redness, or warmth in the arm, and I haven’t had any recent injuries. It's just the stiffness.

Any neck pain, tingling, numbness, or weakness in the hand or fingers?

No, I don’t have any neck pain, tingling, or numbness. The weakness is mostly in the arm, and I can feel it when I try to lift things.

Which part of the arm is stiffest (shoulder, elbow, forearm, or wrist), and is your range of motion limited?

The stiffness is mostly in the shoulder, and yes, my range of motion is definitely limited. I find it hard to lift my arm above my head or out to the side.

Do you have diabetes, thyroid disease, or a history of prolonged shoulder immobilization?

Yes, I have diabetes, and I haven't had any shoulder immobilization or thyroid issues. I've just been living a mostly inactive lifestyle.

Any pain at night or when lying on the affected shoulder?

No, I don’t have any pain at night or while lying on the shoulder. It mainly concerns stiffness during the day.

Any traumatic event or surgery to the shoulder in the past year?

No, I haven't had any traumatic events or surgeries on my shoulder in the past year. Just the ongoing stiffness I've been experiencing.

Any fever, weight loss, or other joint stiffness (hands, hips)?

No fever or weight loss, and I don't have stiffness in any other joints like my hands or hips. It's just the stiffness in my shoulder that's concerning me.

Any pain with passive shoulder movement, or is it mainly limited but not very painful?

It's mainly limited but not very painful when you move it passively. I feel the stiffness more than anything else.

REQUEST TEST: Shoulder_ROM_and_Capsular_Pattern_Exam

RESULTS: - Shoulder Examination: - Inspection: No visible swelling or deformity - Palpation: Tenderness around the shoulder joint - Range of Motion: Decreased passive and active range of motion - Strength Testing: Upper extremity strength 4/5 - Vital Signs: - Blood Pressure: 142/85 mmHg - Heart Rate: 78 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 16 breaths/min - Temperature: 36.6°C (97.9°F) - Blood Tests: - CBC: Within normal limits - CRP: Slightly elevated - Glucose: Elevated - Imaging: - X-ray Shoulder: No acute bony abnormality. Signs consistent with reduced joint space but no significant osteoarthritic changes.

Any capsular pattern noted (external rotation most limited, then abduction, then internal rotation)?

Yes, I’ve noticed that I have the most difficulty with external rotation, then abduction, and internal rotation follows. It feels really stiff when I try to move it in those directions.

Any systemic inflammatory symptoms like prolonged morning stiffness over an hour or multiple joints involved?

No, I don’t have prolonged morning stiffness over an hour or involvement of multiple joints. It's just that stiffness in my shoulder that I've mentioned.

Any history of adhesive capsulitis (“frozen shoulder”) before or in the other shoulder?

No, I don't have any history of frozen shoulder in the past, and I haven't experienced this in the other shoulder either. It's just the one shoulder giving me trouble now.

Any traumatic overuse or repetitive shoulder activities at work or hobbies?

No, I haven’t had any overuse or repetitive shoulder activities. I mostly stay indoors and don't do much physical activity at all.

Any thyroid symptoms or history (fatigue, cold intolerance, abnormal TSH previously)?

No, I haven’t experienced any thyroid symptoms like fatigue or cold intolerance, and I haven't had any abnormal TSH levels. It's just the stiffness in my shoulder that's bothering me.

Any trauma or dislocation history to this shoulder ever?

No, I've never had any trauma or dislocation to this shoulder. It's always been fine until the stiffness started a few months ago.

REQUEST TEST: Shoulder_MRI_without_Contrast

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGSThis is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.
